item.title: The Spiritual Exercises, Episode 8: Self Examination
item.description: In this week's lecture Father moves on to a more practical topic, self examination. As fallen human beings we have a tendency to sin, and if we are to progress in the spiritual life we must understand how this manifests itself in ourselves. Father Trauner explains practices from the Ignatian method which can help us fight these tendencies, namely a particular resolution, morning examination and evening examination of conscience.

item.title: The Spiritual Exercises, Episode 7: The Use of Creation
item.description: "Everything else on earth has been created on earth has been created for man's sake to attain the purpose for which he was created." This week in our study of the Spiritual Exercises Father Trauner explains our relationship with the rest of creation in these terms. It quickly becomes clear that to use the creation properly we must keep moderate our use of God's creatures in light of our own spiritual lives, despite our urge to use creators for temporal gain and pleasure.

item.title: The Spiritual Exercises, Episode 6: The Fundamental Principle
item.description: "Man has been created to praise, reverence and serve our Lord God, thereby saving his soul." Father Trauner goes over this proposition, the meaning of it, and it's consequences. As this is the fundamental principle behind the retreat, it is essential that we all understand and internalize it, otherwise we become like a ship setting out without a destination.

item.title: The Spiritual Exercises, Episode 5: Applying the Exercises
item.description: Today in our series on the Spiritual exercises Fr. Trauner gives some tips on making room for the Spiritual exercises in the circumstances of your own life. It becomes evident that we must find some way to seclude ourselves from the world to properly profit from them.

item.title: The Spiritual Exercises, Episode 4: Week I
item.description: Today we begin the spiritual exercises with reflection on and contemplation of sins. Father Trauner briefly explains the layout of the exercises and then we get into the meat of exercises. We hope this series is an inspiration and help to our listeners' spiritual life.

item.title: The Spiritual Exercises, Episode 3: Introductory Notes
item.description: Today on the show Father Trauner explains the rational behind the Ignation spiritual exercises as we study the first chapter of those exercises. Listen in to learn why we must remove the unnecessary attachments that we inadvertently form with the world and what method we'll be following in the coming episodes to work against that.

item.title: The Spiritual Exercises, Episode 2: History of the Exercises
item.description: Before diving into the Spiritual exercises, we'll begin with an overview of the history of St. Ignatius' Spiritual Exercises. Listen in to learn where they came from and the great role they've had in fortifying the spiritual life of Catholics through the last 500 years.

item.title: The Spiritual Exercises, Episode 1: Introduction
item.description: Today we begin a moving new series with Fr. Arnold Trauner. This week we will look at the history behind retreats and introduce you to the spiritual exercises which we hope you'll join us in through the rest of the series.

item.title: The Sinner's Guide, Episode 8: True Liberty
item.description: Today as we conclude The Sinner's Guide for Season 13 we study the remaining privileges of the just including true liberty. It becomes very clear that the liberty of the world we live in is more often really slavery to sin and is clearly opposed to the true liberty of soul that is given to the just.

item.title: The Sinner's Guide, Episode 7: More Privileges of the Just
item.description: In this episode of The Sinner's Guide Fr. Larrabee continues with the privileges of the just, focusing in on the disturbance of soul that is experienced when in the state of sin. As he explores the book it becomes quite clear that a clean conscience is a great blessing and one we should never take for granted.

item.title: The Sinner's Guide, Episode 6: The Privileges of the Just
item.description: Today on The Sinner's Guide Jason and Fr. Larabee move from the contemplation of the four last things to a more positive focus, the privileges of the just. This conversation servers as a welcome reminder of the great graces which God will give us if only we follow his laws.

item.title: The Sinner's Guide, Episode 5: The Last Judgment, Heaven and Hell
item.description: In today's episode of The Sinner's Guide listen in as Fr. Larrabee shows us a three of the four last things, which are great motives for the practice of virtue - the Last Judgment, Heaven, and Hell. It is a frightening yet encouraging reminder to remember the gravity of our own lives.

item.title: The Sinner's Guide, Episode 4: Gratitude for Our Election and Death
item.description: In this episode of The Sinner's Guide Fr. Larrabee continues with the motives for gratitude to God. Today we are prompted to meditate on the grace of being raised or converted to Catholicism, which so many people now and throughout history haven't had. Through God's mercy we have been given the grace of the Faith and, if we follow Him faithfully, we can hope for eternal salvation. What could we be more grateful for than this undeserved gift? After this happy reflection Father moves to a more somber subject, the first of the four last things.

item.title: The Sinner's Guide, Episode 3: Gratitude for Our Redemption
item.description: In this episode of The Sinner's Guide, Father Larrabee continues on the motives which oblige us to practice virtue, on the subject of gratitude for our redemption and justification.

item.title: The Sinners Guide, Episode 2: Dependence on God
item.description: As we continue our study of the The Sinners Guide Fr. Larrabee goes deeper into the investigation of motives for the love God. Today he covers the gratitude we ought to have for creation and God's other gifts to us.

item.title: The Sinners Guide, Episode 1: Introduction
item.description: We start the summer with a new series based on the book Sinners Guide. Following this great spiritual book we'll begin by delving into the motives for the love of God.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 51: All the Wrong Men
item.description: Dating can be hard as a young traditional Catholic. Distance, culture differences, and generally overthinking courtship, serve to make finding a spouse a bit harder than it was in their parents' or grandparents' generation. In this show Colleen Eldracher shares her perspective of navigating this challenging world without breaking too many hearts.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 50: Succession Crisis
item.description: As the older generation of traditional Catholic ages, its up to younger Catholics to pick up the slack when it comes to volunteering around our chapels. Listen in as Colleen Eldracher details some ways on how to help ease the burden that our parents' and grandparents handled for years.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 49: Don't Break Your Heart When There's No Hope
item.description: In this episode, guest host, Colleen Eldracher shares a few tips on the wider beyond that special one world to look at when dating. Listen in for some insights on the different "levels" of traditionalism!

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 48: Preparing for Motherhood
item.description: In this episode Theresa is joined by a fellow "parishioner" of Mary Help of Christians chapel in Australia. Suzanne is a qualified naturopath who specialises in antenatal, pregnancy, and postnatal care. Their discussion revolves around preparing physically for the all-important vocation of motherhood. Suzanne shares her knowledge of how best to do this. Find out why the engagement period - and not waiting till after the wedding - is when prospective parents should start preparing and improving their health. Check out Suzanne's website for maternal care, New Life Naturopathy, it has interesting information and blog articles.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 47: Christ in the Home ( Part 3)
item.description: Christ in the Home Part 3: Hostess Theresa and her regular guest Jacinta, both of Mary Help of Christians chapel in Melbourne, Victoria, wrap up their overview of the work by Fr Raoul Plus S.J., "Christ in the Home." Copies of this excellent and useful book are available in the True Restoration store

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, Episode 23: Education
item.description:
In this episode of , the then Fr. Sanborn discusses a true Catholic education for children, the role of the mother in this process We are pleased to present a new ongoing project here at True Restoration - From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A! This content will draw from an old television series that ran in the late 1980's to the early 1990's and featured various Traditional Catholic Clergy expounding on the teachings of Holy Mother Church along with current events; similar to our Behind the Headlines project which featured Bp. Dolan and Fr. McKenna. All these episodes live freely on the internet, but for our annual membership we've taken up the task of producing a more polished version of the content in podcast format and focusing on the valuable insights and knowledge of the then Fr. Donald Sanborn. We offer these episodes as a special bonus which will be released throughout the year exclusively to our annual members at the $150 Tier and above. Please enjoy these episodes of vintage Bp. Donald Sanborn!
From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 46: Christ in the Home ( Part 2)
item.description: Christ in the Home Part 2: Theresa and Jacinta of Mary Help of Christians chapel in Melbourne, Victoria, continue their discussion of the book "Christ in the Home." As usual, their conversation is full of amusing and helpful anecdotes based on their personal experiences. Find out more about this wonderful title. Copies available in the True Restoration store: https://truerestoration.org/press/christ-in-the-home/

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 45: Christ in the Home ( Part 1)
item.description: Christ in the Home Part 1: Theresa and Jacinta, the dynamic duo of Mary Help of Christians chapel in Melbourne, Victoria, come back after an unusual hiatus to discuss the signature book of this entire series about the Catholic Home, "Christ in the Home." Find out what is so great about this book and why you should read it.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 72: How to Obtain Grace
item.description:
In this season's last episode of has Father Philip Eldracher and Justin Eldracher wrap up their study of grace, concluding the series with an explanation of the means of grace.
This is Catholicism

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 71: Path to Perfection
item.description:
In this episode of , Father Philip Eldracher and Justin Eldracher continue to examine grace, the different types of grace, and how we must regain sanctifying grace, should we lose it.
This is Catholicism

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 70: How to Achieve Perfection
item.description:
In this episode of , Father Philip Eldracher and Justin Eldracher continue their discussions on Christian perfection with advice on how to achieve it.
This is Catholicism

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 69: Christian Perfection
item.description: Having introduced the listener to grace Father Philip Eldracher and Justin Eldracher continue their study of grace by diving into the topic of Christian perfection. Listen in to learn who is called to it this ideal and how to work toward it!

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, Episode 22: The Bible, Sacred Tradition, and the Anti-Christ
item.description:
In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the credibility and veracity of the Bible and Sacred Tradition. The conversation then moves on to a fascinating exposition on the anti-Christ and what will occur in those times. We are pleased to present a new ongoing project here at True Restoration - From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A! This content will draw from an old television series that ran in the late 1980's to the early 1990's and featured various Traditional Catholic Clergy expounding on the teachings of Holy Mother Church along with current events; similar to our Behind the Headlines project which featured Bp. Dolan and Fr. McKenna.
All these episodes live freely on the internet, but for our annual membership we've taken up the task of producing a more polished version of the content in podcast format and focusing on the valuable insights and knowledge of the then Fr. Donald Sanborn. We offer these episodes as a special bonus which will be released throughout the year exclusively to our annual members at the $150 Tier and above. Please enjoy these episodes of vintage Bp. Donald Sanborn!

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 68: Virtue
item.description: In this week's episode of This is Catholicism, Father Philip Eldracher and Justin Eldracher turn their discussion from sin to virtue with an overview of the different classes of virtue and why we must practice virtue.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 67: Sins Against the Holy Ghost
item.description: This week on This is Catholicism, Father Philip Eldracher and Justin Eldracher study the sins against the Holy Ghost, the sins crying to Heaven for vengeance, and cooperation in sin.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 66: Capital Sins
item.description: This episode of This is Catholicism features, Father Philip Eldracher and Justin Eldracher as they continue their discussions of sin with a study of the capital sins.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 65: Sin in General
item.description: In this opening show of This is Catholicism for this season, Father Philip Eldracher and Justin Eldracher begin their discussions on sin with an overview of the different classes of sin and why we must avoid all sin.

item.title: The Flagship Show, Episode 78: Travel
item.description: Today host Alexander Krawcyzk is joined by Stephen Heiner as they discuss travel, its benefits (beyond as a way to have fun) and how to make the most of it.

item.title: The Flagship Show, Episode 77: Reading
item.description: On today's episode of the Flagship Stephen Heiner joins the show to discuss how to get more out of your reading, and how to bring the lessons found in reading to life. Alexander and Stephen also share some examples of the tidbits that can be related across genres, from non-fiction to sci-fi.

item.title: The Flagship Show, Episode 76: Life as a Lay Helper
item.description: In this episode of the Flagship Show, host Alexander Krawczyk is joined by Stephen Heiner to discuss the lifestyle as a lay helper in a seminary. Over the past year Stephen has been fulfilling this role at Most Holy Trinity Seminary and will share his insights on what it is like to take up the role, and what made him interested in it in the first place.

item.title: The Flagship Show, Episode 75: Israel and Palestine
item.description: Today Stephen Heiner joins the Flagship Show as a guest to discuss the ongoing conflict in the Holy Land. Stephen's perspective on this issue is multifaceted, emphasizing the complexity of the conflict and the necessity for comprehensive understanding before forming opinions. In this show he gives listeners a background shaped by his study of ethnic cleansing and the specific history of this region. It becomes clear that there is a role of Palestinians' choices in the conflict, but they do not merit the current hardships they endure. To close Stephen encourages education on the topic, recommending several books that offer diverse perspectives on the conflict.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, Episode 21: The Novus Ordo
item.description:
In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the beliefs of Novus Ordo Catholics compared with the true Catholic teachings and the effects it has had on the laity. The conversation moves on to some common objections brought about by those in the Novus Ordo. We are pleased to present a new ongoing project here at True Restoration - From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A! This content will draw from an old television series that ran in the late 1980's to the early 1990's and featured various Traditional Catholic Clergy expounding on the teachings of Holy Mother Church along with current events; similar to our Behind the Headlines project which featured Bp. Dolan and Fr. McKenna.
All these episodes live freely on the internet, but for our annual membership we've taken up the task of producing a more polished version of the content in podcast format and focusing on the valuable insights and knowledge of the then Fr. Donald Sanborn. We offer these episodes as a special bonus which will be released throughout the year exclusively to our annual members at the $150 Tier and above. Please enjoy these episodes of vintage Bp. Donald Sanborn!

item.title: The Flagship Show: Episode 74: Crypto
item.description: Matt Gaskin, a seasoned host and co-owner of True Restoration, brings his perspective on crypto-currency to today's Flagship Show. His experiences, including study of Austrian economics and the purchase of bitcoin as early as 2013 bring a valuable perspective to help us understand the financial system. Matt give us a rundown of cryptocurrencies, especially bitcoin and explains the macroeconomics behind them.

item.title: Ad Maiorem Dei Gloriam: Episode 4: Last Years and Legacy
item.description: As his years lengthened, St Ignatius grew ever closer to God, while his order continued to expand its work in the service of the Faith. After St. Ignatius passed to his reward, the Jesuits continued their zealous efforts for souls on every continent, even to the point of martyrdom.

item.title: Ad Maiorem Dei Gloriam, Episode 3: Growth of the Apostolate
item.description: The growth of the Company allowed them move to Rome. But this growth also brought with it challenges and enemies. In this episode, we follow St Ignatius as he overcomes the calumnies of enemies and lays the foundations for the stable growth of the Society of Jesus.

item.title: Ad Maiorem Dei Gloriam, Episode 2: Beginnings of the Company of Jesus
item.description: After converted from soldiering, St. Ignatius visited the holy places. On his return he proceeded to gather followers who would become the seed of the Company, or Society, of Jesus.

item.title: Ad Maiorem Dei Gloriam, Episode 1: Conversion
item.description: In this first new series of the year we are presenting a biography of St Ignatius Loyola, the patron saint of our apostolate. In this episode we follow him through his youth and his conversion from proud soldier to penitent.

item.title: The Flagship Show, Episode 73: Path to the Priesthood
item.description: As our first episode of the year, TR presents an interview with Fr. Bayer that is being co-presented by Roman Catholic Media. Fr. Bayer was ordained recently in 2022, by Bp. Donald Sanborn, and in this episode he shares his path to the traditionalism and eventually Most Holy Trinity Seminary from his conservative Novus Ordo upbringing. Note that this episode was recorded when Father Bayer was still a deacon, so he is referred to as "Rev. Mr." rather than "Fr".

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 9: Progress in Prayer
item.description: In the summary episode for this series, Fr. Trauner pulls together all the ideas spoken about in previous episodes: prayer as a mindset more than an action, the necessity to purge out influences of the world to give space to Our Lord, and the reminder that prayer is not optional: he who prays is saved, he who does not, is damned.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, Episode 20: The Social Kingship of Christ
item.description:
In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the social Kingship of Christ and related topics such as:
The Reign of Christ the King The source of authority The idea of separation of Church and State Objectivity How we would see the manifestation of Christ's Kingship in everyday life The world without His Kingship We are pleased to present a new ongoing project here at True Restoration - From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A! This content will draw from an old television series that ran in the late 1980's to the early 1990's and featured various Traditional Catholic Clergy expounding on the teachings of Holy Mother Church along with current events; similar to our Behind the Headlines project which featured Bp. Dolan and Fr. McKenna.
All these episodes live freely on the internet, but for our annual membership we've taken up the task of producing a more polished version of the content in podcast format and focusing on the valuable insights and knowledge of the then Fr. Donald Sanborn. We offer these episodes as a special bonus which will be released throughout the year exclusively to our annual members at the $150 Tier and above. Please enjoy these episodes of vintage Bp. Donald Sanborn!

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 8: Silence
item.description: Another key aspect of growth in the spiritual life is silence. This silence is not only external, it is internal as well. We must create a space for Our Lord to speak to us, and He cannot be heard over the noise many of us allow in our minds and hearts.

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 7: Reading
item.description: Prayer flows from the topics and ideas that most frequently populate our minds. One of the surest ways to stock our mind with worthy thoughts is through reading the right books.

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 6: Mortification
item.description: Modern man flies from mortification, but without mortification there can be no progress in the spiritual life. Fr. Trauner also discusses the strange paradox that mortification can sometimes be an escape from mortification.

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 5: Proper Dispositions
item.description: We cannot enter into prayer unless we remove those things that hold us back. These can be the most innocuous daily tasks or routines: but nothing is neutral in the Christian life. We must seek to purify our daily actions.

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 4: Challenges in Prayer
item.description: As growing in prayer is also growing in one’s own interior life, there will be challenges along the way. In this episode Fr. Trauner discusses some of those challenges and how to deal with them.

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 3: How Prayer Works
item.description: Prayer is not something that simply "happens" to us. It is something that we must initiate, maintain, and constantly seek to grow in. Also discussed are various preparations and tactics for approaching daily mental prayer.

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 2: What is Prayer?
item.description: In this episode Fr. Trauner explains some basic ways of thinking about prayer and some ideas for how we can grow in it.

item.title: Progress in Prayer, Episode 1: A Prayerful Orientation
item.description: Many Catholics are afraid of prayer, in part because they don’t conceive properly of what it is: not just a conversation with your Creator, but a way of being, a mindset, a way to penetrate all the actions of your waking day. In this first episode of a new series, Fr. Arnold Trauner and host Stephen Heiner set the table for a season-long look at prayer.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 44: Relocation ( Part 3 )
item.description: In this final episode Theresa asks her three guests what they have gained by relocating to Fr. Eldracher's main base in Australia (Mary Help of Christians), and if they have any regrets about their decision. Though the discussion takes some interesting twists and turns into unexpected territory, the guests all end up giving the same advice - Just do it!

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, Episode 19: Catholic Psychology
item.description:
In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses Catholic psychology and how it differs from what the world puts forth as psychology. The lack of doctrinal and moral unity within the Novus Ordo Problems with the Novus Ordo Mass Communion in the Hand Communism The True Conduct of a Pope National Rebellions Against God We are pleased to present a new ongoing project here at True Restoration - From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A! This content will draw from an old television series that ran in the late 1980's to the early 1990's and featured various Traditional Catholic Clergy expounding on the teachings of Holy Mother Church along with current events; similar to our Behind the Headlines project which featured Bp. Please enjoy these episodes of vintage Bp. Donald Sanborn!

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 43: Holistic Health ( Part 3 )
item.description: Part 3 of Holistic Health: Hostess Theresa and her guest and niece, Camille, attendees of Mary Help of Christians chapel in Melbourne, Australia, finish up their discussions on the importance of nutrition for improved physical wellbeing to aid spiritual growth. In this episode they delve deep into the details of supplements. Find out why you would benefit from utilising certain supplements, and most critically, find out which particular ones are best to take and which ones should be avoided.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 42: Relocation ( Part 2 )
item.description: Hostess Theresa continues her conversation with Camille, Augustine and R5 wherein they share their insights about the most important things to attend to in order to make a smooth transition into living near a Mass centre. All of them are enthusiastic about their experiences in this worthy endeavour to be able to live close to Fr. Eldracher's Mary Help of Christians chapel, in Victoria Australia.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 41: Holistic Health ( Part 2 )
item.description: Camille, a qualified naturopath who attends Mary Help of Christians in Australia, returns as Theresa's guest to continue their discussion on Holistic Health particularly emphasising the importance of nutrition and how best to achieve optimal nutrition with real foods.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 40: Relocation to a Mass Centre ( Part 1 )
item.description:
In this episode Theresa chats with her three guests who all relocated to chapel in Melbourne, Australia, to discuss their various backgrounds and situations which led them to desire making such a big move in their lives. Find out why such a relocation is so important for those who don't live near a suitable Mass centre.
Mary Help of Christians

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 39: Holistic Health ( Part 1)
item.description:
In this episode, Theresa is joined by Camille O'Brien, a qualified naturopath based in Australia. In this episode we get into how holistic healthcare can improve our health, and through doing this improve our spiritual health.
Join us next week to return to our exploration of this topic!

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, Episode 18: The Destitution of the Novus Ordo and Rebellion Against God
item.description:
In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses:
The lack of doctrinal and moral unity within the Novus Ordo Problems with the Novus Ordo Mass Communion in the Hand Communism The True Conduct of a Pope National Rebellions Against God We are pleased to present a new ongoing project here at True Restoration - From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A! Donald Sanborn. We offer these episodes as a special bonus which will be released throughout the year exclusively to our annual members at the $150 Tier and above. Please enjoy these episodes of vintage Bp. Donald Sanborn!

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 49: Auctorem Fidei (Part 2)
item.description: After establishing the historical background in the first episode 48, Ethan and Fr. Dutertre delve deeply into the contents of the bull. As we continue our study of the bull, it becomes evident how clearly the papacy has condemned the notion that papal authority is dependent upon any entity other than Christ himself. Further, we get into an explanation of the condemnations of the Jansenist and Lutheran propositions which the synod of Pistoia had put forward.

item.title: The Flagship Show, Episode 72: The YAG
item.description: The Flagship Show comes back for with a special interview with Colleen Eldracher, the organizer of the YAG in Cincinnati. We discuss a bit about the history of the YAG, then dive into what it is today and why (if you're a young adult) you'll love it.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 48: Auctorem Fidei (Part 1)
item.description:
In this episode, Fr. Dutertre and Ethan begin a discussion of Auctorem Fidei by Pope Pius VI. We begin the show with a discussion of the historical context of Auctorem Fidei and the infamous synod of Pistoia which it was written in response to. After building a historical foundation Fr. Duterte goes on to explain the Pope Pius VI's condemnation of the synod of Pistoia and the parallels between it and Vatican II.
Tune in next week for the continuation of our study of Auctorem Fidei!

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 47: Satis Cognitum (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode, Fr. Dutertre and Ethan continue their discussion of Satis Cognitum by Pope Leo XIII. The show begins with a explanation of necessity of Faith in the entire doctrine which the Church has defined as revealed by God. Having established the importance of Faith, Father moves into a discussion of the Rock upon which the Catholic Faith depends, the papacy. The show concludes with a discussion on the authority of the bishops and their relations with the Pope.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, Episode 17: Demons
item.description:
In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses:
The reality of the devils, their fall, and their seeking the eternal ruin of our souls The question of "why must the good suffer?" a question frequently asked in our times, is not only expounded upon but answered What powers do the devils have against man and what are we to think of demonic possessions? Are they true occurrences? The rise of satanism, and their shocking crimes that result
We are pleased to present a new ongoing project here at True Restoration - From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A! This content will draw from an old television series that ran in the late 1980's to the early 1990's and featured various Traditional Catholic Clergy expounding on the teachings of Holy Mother Church along with current events; similar to our Behind the Headlines project which featured Bp. Dolan and Fr. McKenna.
All these episodes live freely on the internet, but for our annual membership we've taken up the task of producing a more polished version of the content in podcast format and focusing on the valuable insights and knowledge of the then Fr. Donald Sanborn. We offer these episodes as a special bonus which will be released throughout the year exclusively to our annual members at the $150 Tier and above. Please enjoy these episodes of vintage Bp. Donald Sanborn!

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 46: Satis Cognitum (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, Fr. Dutertre and Ethan begin a discussion on Satis Cognitum by Pope Leo XIII. The show begins with a history of the interest in church unity during the 19th century, culminating in the modernists efforts to promote their false ecumenism. Having laid the groundwork, Father then explains how this encyclical clearly distinguishes the Catholic church from heretical and schismatic sects as the One, True Church of Christ.

item.title: Trad Reviews, Episode 38: Little Women
item.description: In our final Trad Reviews episode this year, Stephen Heiner and Theresa Arthur team up to review Little Women, focusing on its film adaptations. They also tackle the theme of feminism in the book while exploring it in the context of 19th century Protestant society. Listen in to find out which of the films are hits and which don't quite make the cut!

item.title: Trad Reviews, Episode 37: Goodbye Mr Chips and Wingspan
item.description: Step back in time to a pre-Great War British boarding school, where a dedicated teachers journey alongside generations of boys unravels powerful life lessons. The Old World setting and character growth combine to create an enchanting and wholesome cinematic experience. Prepare to be moved by the timeless values, heartfelt connections, and the transformative power of this cinematic masterpiece. In this episode, Paul Wesner also brings us a review of the delightfully wholesome board game, Wingspan, where strategic gameplay intertwines with an enlightening exploration of birds.

item.title: Trad Reviews, Episode 36: The Simple Life
item.description: While many films glorify the exploits of outstanding characters, few of us are called to emulate this type of heroism. Today we'll look at a pair of films that focus on that "simple life" which most of us are called too. Both movies transport viewers to small town America in the 1940s, immersing them in sweet and beautiful narratives that depict the simple joys and struggles of everyday life.

item.title: Trad Reviews, Episode 35: The School of Life
item.description: Today we'll look a classic film of boyish adventure and as well as a great Catholic novel. With both gripping plot and heroic characters, these stories provide inspiring entertainment to younger readers and watchers. From the castles of Scotland to the Grand Banks both the book - Outlaws of Ravenhurst - and the film - Captains Courageous - teach life lessons no school could.

item.title: Trad Reviews, Episode 34: Aviation Films
item.description: In the 1940s World War II films figured prominently in American cinema as filmmakers joined in the war effort. Today we'll look at two such war films which depict the heroic exploits of American air crews. These war films strike a great balance between showing the extreme conditions of war and, at the same time, the humanity of the soldiers who found themselves there. Continuing our focus on the open skies we'll also look at a different type of airplane centred entertainment -- flight simulators.

item.title: Trad Reviews, Episode 33: The Nun’s Story
item.description: In this episode, we take a deep dive into the classic film, The Nuns Story staring Audrey Hepburn. The film takes us on a journey into the life of a nun and shows us in stunning detail what such a life entails. It takes us also on the spiritual journey one goes through in such a life a life filled with many joys but also many crosses. In a larger sense however, and with the passing of time, our film can take on a whole new meaning when viewed through the lens of the current crisis we are living through in the aftermath of Vatican II, and we get a glimpse of just how much we truly lost.

item.title: Trad Reviews, Episode 32: John Ford and John Wayne Westerns
item.description: In this episode, we'll focus on two western films, both of which were directed by John Wayne and starred John Ford. These films showcase the romance and beauty of the old American West as well as the life and death struggle that was frontier life. While the "Old West" of film is only an idealized version of history, its a great antidote to the decadence and sterility of modern society.

item.title: Trad Reviews, Episode 31: Boys Town
item.description: In this new season of TradReviews, we dive into the era of classic films and explore them as an option for good wholesome recreation; after all we have the Legion of Decency to turn to for ratings for films during this era. In this episode, we'll focus on the classic religious films duology of Boys Town and Men of Boys Town staring Spencer Tracey and Mickey Rooney. We'll also take a look at the exciting hobby of 3D printing.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, Episode 15: The New Mass, The Ottaviani Intervention, and Communion in the Hand
item.description:
In this episode of , the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the problems with the Novus Ordo Mass. Is it a return to the practices of the early Church or rather an incorporation of protestant ideas? What effect does the reception of Communion of the hand have on the faithful, and is it really a return to the practice of the early Church? Lastly, Fr. Sanborn discusses the Ottaviani Intervention.
From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 34: Sacraments: the Eucharist
item.description: The Eucharist is at the heart of all the other sacraments. If it is not properly understood for what it is, a sacrifice that produces the true Body, Blood, Soul, and Divinity of Our Lord Jesus Christ, it is as worthless as the Vatican 2 sect treats it.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 33: Sacraments: Baptism and Marriage
item.description: Baptism is the entrance into the Christian life through sanctifying grace. Marriage is an indissoluble union which Our Lord blessed by performing his first miracle at one. Vatican 2 seeks to undermine both of these sacraments by lessening their importance, and in the case of marriage, by seeking to make it dissolvable.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 32: Ecumenism
item.description: In this episode Stephen and Father discuss the Catholic notion of ecumenism (“return”) and how Vatican 2 has perverted this into an idea of a one world religion (“convergence”).

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 31: Thomism
item.description: His Holiness Pope Leo XIII issued Aeterni Patris to give new life to Thomism in the heart of the Church. This was something the Modernists could not abide. Fr. Trauner explains how the Modernists sought to relegate Thomism to simply one idea among many, and worse, as simply a method, rather than a system of thought.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 30: The Revolution and Democracy; Collegiality
item.description: Anthropocentrism in our time comes primarily from the French Revolution and its false ideas about democracy. Also discussed are the problems inherent in national episcopal conferences and the Vatican 2 notion of collegiality.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 14: Religious Liberty, Vatican 2, and Baptism
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses religious liberty in the context of Vatican 2 versus what the Catholic Church has always taught. Also discussed are the Church's teaching on Baptisms of Blood and Desire.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 29: Three Cities and Secondary Christianity
item.description: While the idea of the “two cities” has been discussed since St. Augustine first wrote about them, Professor Amerio proposes a third city, spawned by the Revolution and its descendants: a city of indifference which espouses what he calls Secondary Christianity. Also discussed is the idea of civilization as a side effect, not an end, of Christianity.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 28: Work and Technology
item.description: In this episode host Stephen Heiner and guest Fr. Arnold Trauner talk about how much work has changed since the introduction of advanced technology and how a kind of worship of technology ties in with the idea of man as the measure of all things. Also mentioned are some ideas from Laborem Exercens by JP2.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 27: Man as the Measure, Anthropocentricity, and Perfectibility
item.description: In this episode host Stephen Heiner and guest Fr. Arnold Trauner discuss the governing philosophy of the modern world: man as the center of all things. This idea will be central in understanding the implications of such anthropocentricity in every facet of modern life.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 13: The Modern World - A Spirit of Revolution
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the modern world, its origins, and its conflict against the Catholic world. How does the modern world view such things as religion, work, art, music, birth control, family?

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 16: The Seventy-Seven Graces
item.description: In this concluding episode, Father Larrabee overviews the Seventy-Seven Graces and Fruits to Be Derived from Devout Attendance at Holy Mass as a summary of the book. Chapter 3: The Mysteries of Holy Mass - Seventy-seven Graces and Fruits to be Derived from Devout Attendance at Holy Mass

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 15: Devotions to be Practiced at the Elevation
item.description: The Elevation at Mass is the central ceremony of Holy Mass, the most important part of the Mass that takes place at the consecration itself. At the very time that transubstantiation takes place. Chapters: 29. The Devotions to be Practiced at the Elevation -What Our Behavior Ought to Be after the Consecration; 30. The Reverence with which We Ought to Hear Holy Mass.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 14: Hear Mass Daily and Devoutly
item.description: There is no hour in the whole day that is as precious as the time that we hear Mass. Hearing Mass contributes to our eternal salvation, our whole purpose of existence. Chapters: 27. An Exhortation to Hear Holy Mass Daily -The Example of the Saints Is an Incentive to Us to Hear Mass Daily; 28. An Exhortation to Hear Holy Mass Devoutly.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 13: Great Merit Is Gained by Offering Holy Mass in a Right Manner
item.description: The Mass is unique from any other act of devotion. The merits of Christ are given to us by Christ in the Mass and we offer these merits to God in payment of our debts in order to purchase every grace and benefit that we need from God. That is the central idea of why the Mass is so powerful and effective. Chapters: 25. Great Merit Is Gained by Offering Holy Mass in a Right Manner The Infinite Value of the Victim Offered to God in Holy Mass 26. Some Practical Hints Concerning the Way of Hearing Several Masses at One and the Same Time

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 12: Priests and Angels Pray and Our Work
item.description: Go to Mass and unite your prayers with the prayers of the priest, which are also the prayers of Christ. Your own prayers which are imperfect will be made perfect by this union.Satan tries to deceive us to prevent us from going to Mass by all sorts of means. The most common excuse being that we have to work. Chapters: 23. The Manner and the Measure in which the Priest and the Angels Pray for Those Who are Present at Holy Mass; 24. Holy Mass Does Not Hinder Our Work, but Helps Us with It.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 12: The Second Vatican Council and Freedom of Conscience
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the Second Vatican Council and the freedom of conscience that resulted from it. Are the errors we see in the Novus Ordo only the result of bad clergy not following the hierarchy, as some would claim? How did Vatican 2 ever even happen?

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 11: Hope of the Dying and Succor of the Departed
item.description: We should pray for the dead that they may rest in peace. Let us offer to God the sacrifice of justice and then trust in the Lord that we will also rest in peace in the end. When we offer Mass we are giving God infinite satisfaction, honor, and service. We are making reparation for our sins. Better than almost any other possible way. Chapters: 21. Holy Mass is the Most Certain Hope of the Dying; 22. Holy Mass is the Unfailing Succor of the Departed.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 10: Greatest Benefit to the Faithful
item.description: According to Father Larrabee, this episode covers the two most useful chapters of the Incredible Catholic Mass. Everyone wants to know what benefits are on offer at Mass and how the Mass procures an increase of grace and glory hereafter. Chapters: 19. Holy Mass Is of the Greatest Benefit to the Faithful; 20. Holy Mass Procures for Us an Increase of Grace Here and of Glory Hereafter; Holy Mass Increases the Celestial Glory which Is to Be Our Portion; Spiritual Communion.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 9: Sublime Work of the Holy Ghost and Sweetest Joy to the Mother of God
item.description: The Holy Ghost works for our temporal and spiritual welfare, pleading for us in a special manner during the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass. The Holy Mass, the greatest joy of Our Lady and of the Blessed, is the greatest help of the living and the best assistance to the faithful departed. Chapters: 17. Holy Mass is the Most Sublime Work of the Holy Ghost. 18. Holy Mass Affords the Sweetest Joy to the Mother of God and to the Saints.

item.title: Why the Cross?, Episode 12: The End for Which We are Made
item.description: In the final episode of this series on the book Why the Cross by Fr. Edward Leen, C.S.Sp. Father Trauner covers: Investing in Eternity; Risking one’s life; Always keeping God in our minds. We hope that this series inspired you to read the book, dear listeners, and when you have finished it, read it again, and again.

item.title: Why the Cross?, Episode 11: Prayer and Reflection
item.description: This series is an ongoing look at themes in the book Why the Cross by Fr. Edward Leen, C.S.Sp. In this episode Father Trauner covers: Becoming closer to Our Lord; What “service to God” really means; The necessity of poverty in every sense of the word.

item.title: Why the Cross?, Episode 10: Be Perfect
item.description: This series is an ongoing look at themes in the book Why the Cross by Fr. Edward Leen, C.S.Sp. In this episode Father Trauner covers: The means of perfection; Hatred of the sin, not the sinner (including yourself!); Conquering a tendency away from our Lord.

item.title: Why the Cross?, Episode 9: The Cross
item.description: This series is an ongoing look at themes in the book Why the Cross by Fr. Edward Leen, C.S.Sp. In this episode Father Trauner covers: The true position of the Cross in our lives; God’s reasons are not our reasons; The contrast of Eden and Calvary.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 11: The Second Vatican Council and Religious Liberty
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the Second Vatican Council and the religious liberty which it promulgated, and the horrible effects that have resulted not only among Catholics but the world at large such as the increase in immorality and loss of vocations.

item.title: The History of Christendom, Episode 7: 1914-2022 Secularism Part II
item.description: In this episode of The History of Christendom, we conclude our discussion on the modern era with His Excellency, Bp. Donald Sanborn, and host Stephen Heiner with a focus on the writings of Monsignor Delassus and Fr. Denis Fahey, and the organized forces of naturalism. We are pleased to offer this episode in both audio and video formats.

item.title: The History of Christendom, Episode 6: 1914-2022 Secularism Part I
item.description: In this episode of The History of Christendom, we enter the modern world with His Excellency, Bp. Donald Sanborn, and host Stephen Heiner. This episode will take us from 1914-2022 and covers a wide range of historical events and the erroneous beliefs that ushered in this age of secularism. We are pleased to offer this episode in both audio and video formats.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 10: The Role of Women
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the proper role of women in society as ordained by Almighty God. Father also comments on several arguments the modern world will make against their role, and what role did Communism play in these ideas?

item.title: The History of Christendom, Episode 5: 1815-1914 Restoration
item.description: In this episode of The History of Christendom, His Excellency, Bp. Donald Sanborn, guides us through the struggles of the Church in the 19th century with host Stephen Heiner. This episode will take us from 1815-1914. We are pleased to offer this episode in both audio and video formats.

item.title: The History of Christendom, Episode 4: 1789-1814 Revolution
item.description: In this episode of The History of Christendom, His Excellency, Bp. Donald Sanborn, guides us through the age of revolution with host Stephen Heiner. This episode will take us from 1789-1814.

item.title: The History of Christendom, Episode 3: 1649-1788 - Freemasonry
item.description: In this episode of The History of Christendom, His Excellency, Bp. Donald Sanborn, guides us through the rise of freemasonry with host Stephen Heiner. This episode will take us from 1649-1788.

item.title: The History of Christendom, Episode 2: 1274-1648 - The Rise of Protestantism
item.description: In this episode of The History of Christendom, His Excellency, Bp. Donald Sanborn, guides us through the end of the Middle Ages and the rise of Protestantism with host Stephen Heiner. This episode will take us from 1274-1648.

item.title: The History of Christendom, Episode 1: From the Edict of Milan to 1274
item.description: In this episode of The History of Christendom, His Excellency, Bp. Donald Sanborn, guides us through the early ages of the Church with host Stephen Heiner. This episode will take us from the Edict of Milan to 1274.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 9: Novus Ordo Laity Performing Clerical Functions, Modesty in Church, The Soviet Union and Communism
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses a then current news item about the laity being called upon to perform clerical functions due to a shortage of priests; a shortage that of course, as Fr. Sanborn explains, is a result of Vatican II. Afterwards, the conversation changes to a discussion of another news item in which a Novus Ordo priest was removed after trying to enact a dress code at his parish. Finally, the episode wraps up as Fr. Sanborn expounds on then recent happenings with the Soviet Union and "Pope" John Paul II's view of the changes occurring at the time in Eastern Europe.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 30: St. Therese of Lisieux Films
item.description: In this episode of TradReviews, Alexander reviews two different films on the life of St. Therese of Lisieux: Miracle of St. Therese and Therese: The Story of Saint Therese of Lisieux, and as a conclusion throws in two book recommendations on her life.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 29: St. Luke Productions - St. John of the Cross and St. Francis of Assisi Films
item.description: In this episode of TradReviews, we speak about St. Luke Productions and focus in on two of their cinematic offerings: John of the Cross and St. Francis of Assisi: Troubadour of God's Peace. Just how good are these films? Are they worth the money to add to your collection? Join us as we review them!

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 28: Brain Games
item.description: In this episode of TradReviews, we dive into the world of logic and deduction as Alexander K. explains one of the world's most popular games: Sudoku! The fun soon jumps off of the pages and into your hands as he concludes the episode with a look at 3D brain teasers and puzzles, and also throws in a bonus with a glimpse of Wordle.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 27: Pride and Prejudice, The Prisoner, and Blokus
item.description: In this episode, Stephen Heiner discusses Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice, the 1960s television series The Prisoner, and the board game Blokus.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 8: Women Priests, Abortion, and How Catholics Should View Art and Modern Media
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the proper use of modern media and art, as well as the restrictions which Holy Mother Church justly places upon its usage for the good of the faithful. The conversation then shifts to a then current news story in which two women celebrated Mass with a Novus Ordo Priest at the Altar. Fr. Sanborn comments on this item and the idea of "women priests," as well as the failure of the Novus Ordo Hierarchy to condemned not only this, but also those Catholics who are pro-choice or pro-life but with exceptions.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 26: Dune
item.description: In this all-desert episode of TradReviews Stephen Heiner reviews the Frank Herbert novel and Denis Villeneuve film of the same name, and Paul Wesner reviews the board game.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 25: Master and Commander, and Axis and Allies
item.description: In this episode of TradReviews, Matthew and Alexander Arthur take us on a tour of the board game series Axis and Allies, before heading out to sea with the film Master and Commander.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 24: The Sound of Music (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode of TradReviews, Jacinta and Theresa wrap up their review of The Sound of Music along with its related media and bring to a conclusion our journey into the life of the von Trapp family.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 23: The Sound of Music (Part 1)
item.description: Everyone's favorite female Aussie duo is back with their review of the famous The Sound of Music film, a lesser-known version, as well as the various books written by Maria von Trapp. Theresa and Jacinta serve up more than just reviewing these media items, but take us on a journey into the life story of the von Trapp family.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 7: The Roots of Problems in the Modern World, Purgatory, and Taking the Lord's Name in Vain
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the causes of the problems we see in the modern world: the forgetting of Original Sin, self-love, feminism, and a lack of respect for authority. The discussion then moves onto a reflection on Purgatory, as well as the taking of the Lord's Name in Vain.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 12: Our Sorrowful Mother (Part 1)
item.description: In this season finale of Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, we find Our Lady in Jerusalem entering her time of sorrow during the Passion of Our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. How much did Our Lady know beforehand as to what would transpire? What does it mean for her to be our Co-Redemptrix; a belief that has been attacked by Jorge Bergoglio commonly known as "Pope Francis." Father as always guides us through these and other considerations as we seek to better know Our Lady's Sorrowful Heart.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 11: Our Lady during Our Lords Hidden Life and Public Life
item.description: In this episode of Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, we follow Our Lady into the Hidden Life of Our Lord. What was the Holy Family's life like during this period? From there comes the Miracle at Cana and Our Lord's public life. Father guides us through these periods and teaches us what Our Lady's life consisted of and the lessons we can learn from her.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 10: Our Lady and the Childhood of Our Lord
item.description: In this episode of Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, we continue our study of the life of the Blessed Virgin Mary during the childhood of Our Blessed Lord. We see the coming of the Magi bearing their gifts; the flight of the Holy Family into Egypt, their life during this period, and then their return home. From there, the discussion moves on to the loss of the Child Jesus and the subsequent finding of Him in the Temple. As always Fr. Nkamuke explains not only the events, but the deeper lessons which we may take and apply to our own spiritual lives.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 9: The Presentation in the Temple
item.description: In our season premiere of Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, we continue our study of the life of the Blessed Virgin Mary with the Presentation in the Temple and the events which accompany it, such as the Purification of Our Lady, the Circumcision of Our Lord, and the Prophecy of Simeon.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 6: The Sacred Heart of Jesus, Problems with the Novus Ordo Rite of Priestly Ordination and Scandals Among Their Clergy
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses several of the promises attached to devotion to the Sacred Heart of Jesus. The discussion then moves on to the problems with the new rite of ordination promulgated by "Paul VI" and how we should view those "priests" and the sacraments they attempt to confer. Also discussed are the various scandals and immorality committed by the clergy within the Novus Ordo and a look at how the true Church has dealt with such matters in the past.

item.title: Clerical Conversations, Episode 36: Seminary Update
item.description: In this episode of Clerical Conversations, Host Stephen Heiner is joined by His Excellency, Bishop Donald Sanborn, to reflect on the rapid (though expected) growth of the seminary and convent. Stephen reflects on his recent visit to the seminary and some of the realities that those unfamiliar with such a life should prepare for. His Excellency shares some reasons why he thinks the growth is happening, and what may have to be done in the near future to accommodate the harvest.

item.title: Clerical Conversations, Episode 35: Ralliement
item.description: In this episode of Clerical Conversations, Host Stephen Heiner is joined by His Excellency, Bishop Donald Sanborn, to explain the 1892 Ralliement issued by Pope Leo XIII to the French people and its larger context for the Church’s cooperation with fiercely anticlerical regimes.

item.title: Clerical Conversations, Episode 34: Tricolor National Flags
item.description: In this episode of Clerical Conversations, Host Stephen Heiner is joined by His Excellency, Bishop Donald Sanborn, to discuss modern national tricolor flags, many of which were inspired by the French revolutionary flag, which has its own sordid history. His Excellency reflects on whether such a symbol can be reconciled with Christianity.

item.title: Clerical Conversations, Episode 33: Concordats
item.description: In this episode of Clerical Conversations, Host Stephen Heiner is joined by His Excellency, Bishop Donald Sanborn, to discuss the role of Concordats in recent Church history. His Excellency explains what concordats are and then reflects on the 1801 Concordat with France and the 1929 Concordat with Italy, respectively, and discusses the pros and cons of each for Church/state relations.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 5: New World Order and the Anti-Christ
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the development of a New World Order and it's purely naturalistic nature versus the supernatural life and motives which Our Lord calls us to. The conversation includes a discussion of attempts to rebuild the Temple in Jerusalem.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 18: Quo Vadis?
item.description:
Many terrorist attacks have happened since 2002 when the book was first published. We give a roll call of some of them and then revisit Dr. Trifkovic’s five policy points he had offered at that time for dealing with the Islamic threat. We also ask him whether he would be able to publish such a book today and what the consequences would be if he were able to.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 17: The Enemy Within
item.description:
We revisit some of the predictions made by Dr. Trifkovic 20 years ago. Dr. Trifkovic also explains “Al-taqiya” and its role in the public statements of Islamic apologists.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 16: Western Appeasement: Saudi Arabia
item.description:
In this episode Dr. Trifkovic turns our attention to a “great ally” of the United States, Saudi Arabia, and the ongoing challenges that country has faced and will continue to face, as well as its “zero tolerance” policy towards any outward shows of Christianity.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 15: Western Appeasement: Chechnya, Turkey, Pakistan
item.description:
Dr. Trifkovic explores the recent history of Chechnya and Turkey and the new military posture of Pakistan since it has acquired nuclear technology.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 14: Western Appeasement: Asia, Bosnia, Kosovo
item.description:
In this part of the series, we will take a look at some specific geographic areas in which Islam has made life difficult for non-Muslims, often doing so with the approval, implicit and explicit, of the West, particularly the United States.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 13: The Jews and the “Golden Age” that Never Was
item.description:
Islam has some “tough words” for the Jews, to say the least. In this episode Dr. Trifkovic links the doctrinal beliefs of Islam towards Jews and how that played out in both remote and recent history. Dr. Trifkovic also questions the narrative of Islam being a “contributor” to Western civilization instead of simply being a broker by means of distributing the knowledge and goods of the people it conquered.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 12: Women, Slavery, and Human Trafficking
item.description:
Islam does not truly consider women as equivalents to men in any sense of the word and this theological belief has everyday implications which also spill over into horrible treatment of children and African blacks.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 11: Recap and The Role of Shari’a
item.description:
It has been some years since the first half of this program was aired and so we briefly recapitulate some assumptions about what we’ve covered in the series so far before diving into the role of Shari’a in Islamic societies and what is implied for Shari’a in Western societies. While it would be best to start listening to this series from the beginning, it is possible to listen to this group of episodes before going back to the start. We can never know enough about this terrible enemy of Christianity.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 4: The Immaculate Conception and Annulments
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the Immaculate Conception and Our Lady in the early Church. The conversation then shifts to annulments within the Catholic Church prior to the Second Vatican Council, and the radical change and explosion in numbers we've seen since Vatican II.

item.title: Why the Cross? Episode 8: What Must I Do?
item.description: In this episode Father Trauner covers: How “what must I do to be saved?” is a question that completely misses the point of Our Lord’s mission here on earth; what we must do to let Our Lord work in us; the importance of humility.

item.title: Why the Cross? Episode 7: Happiness
item.description: In this episode Father Trauner covers: How we can be truly happy even in this life; God’s plans for our sainthood; the false idea that happiness = pleasure.

item.title: Why the Cross? Episode 6: The Role of Suffering
item.description: In this episode Father Trauner covers: The false relationship many place between “happiness” and “good things happening;” the purpose of suffering; the proper relationship between happiness and suffering.

item.title: Why the Cross? Episode 5: Our Daily Lives
item.description: In this episode Father Trauner covers: The contrast of man’s willingness to strive for earthly gain and his unwillingness to strive for heavenly gain; the trap of vanity; the tyranny of “what others think.”

item.title: Why the Cross? Episode 4: Our Lord Jesus Christ
item.description: In this episode Father Trauner covers: the theory of life of Our Lord Jesus Christ (and why we must make it completely our own); Our Lord’s example as viator; the burden of sin Our Blessed Lord bore; the false acceptance the Jews gave Our Lord on Palm Sunday.

item.title: Why the Cross? Episode 3: The Role of Religion
item.description: In this episode Father Trauner covers: the wisdom of the Church on even worldly matters; the false idea that the Gospel is a record of a philanthropic mission; the clinging of modern man to this passing life.

item.title: Why the Cross? Episode 2: The Christian Life
item.description: In this episode, Father Trauner covers: the pervasive worldliness in the views of many Christians; the anti-Christian nature of much of the art and literature of the modern world; the desire of modern man for Eden, but not for God.

item.title: Why the Cross? Episode 1: Frenetic Intemperance
item.description:
Restoration Radio listeners over the years may have been used to hearing Fr. Trauner and Stephen discuss history and doctrine, but this season they will have a chance to hear them discuss spiritual matters using the text Why the Cross by Fr. Edward Leen, C.S.Sp.
The approach in each episode will be to share a few quotes from the text on a specific theme and have Father develop the ideas a bit further.
The series is no substitute for actually reading the book, and we hope that these episodes may whet the appetite of our listeners for the material, which they can find in our bookstore.
In this episode Father covers: the frenetic intemperance with which modern man lives his life; the desire of modern man to “add a cubit to his stature”; the inability of modern man to be still and know that God is God.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 3: The Blessed Sacrament and the Four Last Things
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn first discusses attacks against belief in the Blessed Sacrament of the Altar and expounds on the Catholic doctrine regarding this Sacrament. The conversation then turns to a discussion on the Four Last Things.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 32: Review: from Jerusalem to Vatican I
item.description: As a wrap-up to everything that was learned in all the previous episodes of this series, Father and Stephen briefly discuss each Council and what was covered at each, in the following order: Jerusalem, Nicea I, Constantinople I, Ephesus, Chalcedon, Constantinople II, Constantinople III, Nicea II, Constantinople IV, Lateran I, Lateran II, Lateran III, Lateran IV, Lyons I, Lyons II, Vienne, Constance, Florence, Lateran V, Trent, and Vatican I. There will be no quiz, dear listeners, but we hope that this inspires you to go back into Church history and learn more of how the Holy Spirit has protected and guided the Barque of Peter for two millennia.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 31: Vatican I: The Last Valid Council of the Church
item.description: In this episode of The Councils, Father and Stephen give an overview of what happened at the Vatican Council. While the main subject dealt with was infallibility, Father and Stephen also discuss how the Council was conducted: because of the telegraph this was the first Church council that was happening “live” to the world. They also discuss how the Council was prematurely interrupted and never formally closed.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 30: Vatican I: Political and Religious Pressures
item.description: In this episode of The Councils, Father and Stephen give the political and religious background to the Vatican Council. They discuss the spread of: Anti-clericalism, Nationalism, Josephism, Naturalism, Rationalism, and Social Atheism. They also give some background on the political upheavals of the time period and give a resume of Pope Pius IX’s time in office up to and including planning the Council. The battle lines regarding infallibility were drawn and there were Council Fathers for and against a formal definition.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 29: The Council of Trent Part IV: Legacy
item.description: In this episode of The Councils, Father and Stephen look at the legacy of the Council of Trent. We still live in a “post-Trent” era, one that Christians for 1500 years never saw. Things that came out of the Council that we now take as givens include: A Universal Catechism and Calendar;a Code of Canon Law (which would be finally collected and issued under St. Pius X in one volume); a standard Mass and breviary; seminaries and universal training standards for priests; Bishops only holding one see and residing in that see; regular synods held by bishops; the Index of Forbidden Books; Congregation of Rites; Congregation of the Council. This is one of the most important Councils in Church history and certainly the most important in our era.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 28: The Council of Trent Part III: The Council Continues
item.description: In this episode of The Councils Father and Stephen give an overview of the final sessions of the Council, from 1552-1564. During this time the following subjects were covered: The lingering problem of conciliarism, The Mass, Holy Orders, Episcopal residence, Matrimony, The Eucharist, Penance and Extreme Unction, Purgatory, Veneration of the Saints and Relics, Indulgences. During this time period Julius III dies and Marcellus II is elected, followed by Paul IV.

item.title: The Flagship Show, Episode 71: True Restoration
item.description: In this episode of the Flagship show, guest host Mario Derksen sits down with True Restoration Founder Stephen Heiner to find out how the website developed into the multi-pronged apostolate it was today, and how his journey to sedevacantism came through the questions and statements of an SSPX bishop.

item.title: The Flagship Show, Episode 70: Novus Ordo Watch
item.description: In this episode of the Flagship show, host Stephen Heiner sits down with Mario Derksen, the man behind Novus Ordo Watch, and gets the origin story of how Mario found authentic Catholicism and how Novus Ordo Watch grew from a section on an existing site to its own full-fledged apostolate that he runs full-time today.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 27: The Council of Trent Part II: The Council Proceeds
item.description: In this episode of The Councils, Father and Stephen give an overview of the first 16 sessions of the Council, from 1545-1552. During this time the following subjects were covered: How the Council would deal with reform and dogma (on parallel tracks); the sources of Faith for the Church; the status of the Vulgate and rules for printing religious books; Original Sin; justification; the Eucharist; penance and Extreme Unction; clerical life and dress. During this time period Paul III dies and Julius III is elected. In 1552 the Council is suspended and is not brought back into session for another ten years.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 26: The Council of Trent Part I: Political and Religious Pressures
item.description: In this episode of The Councils, Father and Stephen give the political and religious background to the Council of Trent. They discuss: The political status quo of German speaking lands; the health and financial crises in Europe; the failure of Paul III to successfully convoke a council in the years before Trent is finally called; the unwillingness of Protestants to attend.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 25: The Fifth Lateran Council
item.description: In this episode of The Councils, Father and Stephen cover the Fifth Lateran Council, which ended in 1517, a few months before Luther’s 95 Theses were posted in Germany. The Council was called primarily to deal with: rooting out of schism, reform of the Church, and the crusade against the Turks. It also dealt with the: Pragmatic Sanction, Pseudo-Council of Pisa, and the Monti de Pieta.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 2: Infiltration of the Catholic Church
item.description: In this episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the current crisis in the Church in the light of various documents speaking about an infiltration within the Church. Documents such as the Alta Vendita, as well as the encyclical Pascendi Dominici Gregis in which Pope St. Pius X speaks of an infiltration.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 64: The Third, Fourth, and Fifth Commandments of the Church
item.description: In this season finale of This is Catholicism, Father Philip Eldracher and Peter Eldracher finish their discussions on the Commandments of the Church by discussing the Third, Fourth, and Fifth Commandments. Please note that the Sixth Commandment of the Church, according to the book, will be covered with the Sacrament of Matrimony.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 63: The Second Commandment of the Church (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Peter Eldracher finish discussing the Second Commandment of the Church which is, "to observe the laws of abstinence and fasting laid down by the Church."

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 62: The First and Second Commandments of the Church
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Peter Eldracher finish discussing the First Commandment of the Church before moving onto the Second which is, "to observe the laws of abstinence and fasting laid down by the Church."

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 61: The First Commandment of the Church
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Peter Eldracher discuss the First Commandment of the Church in which we are "commanded, in the first place, to keep holy the Sundays and the Holydays which the Church has instituted in honor of our Lord and of His Saints, by resting from servile work."

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 60: The Tenth Commandment and The Commandments of the Church
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Peter Eldracher discuss the Tenth Commandment of God which will bring their discussions on the Ten Commandments to a conclusion. Before finishing the episode, Father and Peter begin their next discussion topic which will be on the Commandments of the Church.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 59: The Eighth Commandment
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Peter Eldracher discuss the Eighth Commandment and the various ways in which one sins against this Commandment. As well as what must be done in order to make reparation for the injury done to our neighbors reputation.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 58: The Seventh Commandment
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Peter Eldracher discuss the Seventh Commandment and the various ways in which one sins against this Commandment. As well as what must be done in order to make reparation for these sins.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 57: The Sixth and Ninth Commandments
item.description: In this first episode of the season, Father Philip Eldracher is joined by his brother, Peter Eldracher, as they discuss the Sixth and Ninth Commandments and the means to avoid sins against holy purity.

item.title: From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn QA, Episode 1: Abortion, Attacks Against Christianity, Our Lady of Lourdes
item.description: In our premiere episode of From the Archives: Fr Donald Sanborn Q and A, the then Fr. Sanborn discusses the issue of abortion in the modern world, the ridiculous concept of opposing abortion but allowing it in certain cases, and his thoughts on civil disobedience such as Operation Rescue. The conversation then continues on to attacks on Christianity by the secular media and the world at large and is concluded with a discussion on Our Lady of Lourdes.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 38: The Four Temperaments Parent's Guide – Part 2
item.description: We conclude our series on the Temperaments with Hostess Theresa and her recurring guest Jacinta.
