In this episode, they conclude a casual and frank conversation about the Four Temperaments and how the characteristics and tendencies of each temperament come out in children as they grow up and how to utilize knowledge of each temperament to aid in the proper rearing of children.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 37: The Four Temperaments Parent's Guide – Part 1
item.description: We continue our series on the Temperaments with Hostess Theresa now joined by her recurring guest Jacinta. In this episode, they begin a casual and frank conversation about the Four Temperaments and how the characteristics and tendencies of each temperament come out in children as they grow up and how to utilize knowledge of each temperament to aid in the proper rearing of children.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 36: The Four Temperaments Round Table – Part 3
item.description: We continue with Hostess Theresa and her four guests, all young adults of the Mary Help of Christians Australian Mission: Matthew, Augustine, Alexander and Angela with the final episode of their casual and frank conversation about the Four Temperaments and how the characteristics and tendencies of each come into play in our everyday lives. This episode will more specifically deal with the Melancholic and Phlegmatic temperments. Emphasis on conquering our vices and growth in virtue utilizing the knowledge of our temperaments is the primary goal. Please see our website for materials related to this episode.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 35: The Four Temperaments Round Table – Part 2
item.description: We continue with Hostess Theresa and her four guests, all young adults of the Mary Help of Christians Australian Mission: Matthew, Augustine, Alexander and Angela with the second episode of their casual and frank conversation about the Four Temperaments and how the characteristics and tendencies of each come into play in our everyday lives. This episode will more specifically deal with the Sanguine and Choleric temperments. Emphasis on conquering our vices and growth in virtue utilizing the knowledge of our temperaments is the primary goal. Please see our website for materials related to this episode.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 34: The Four Temperaments Round Table – Part 1
item.description: Hostess Theresa is joined by four guests, all young adult Australians of Mary Help of Christians chapel: Matthew, Augustine, Alexander, and Angela in a light-hearted and entertaining discussion about the Four Temperaments and how the characteristics and tendencies of each come into play in our everyday lives. Emphasis on conquering our vices and growth in virtue utilizing the knowledge of our temperaments is the primary goal. Please see our website for materials related to this episode.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 33: Strange Wanderings: A Conversion Story of a Young Australian – Part 3
item.description: In this episode, we conclude our journey with Hostess Theresa and guest Augustine – who both now attend Mary Help of Christians Chapel in Australia – as we finish accompanying him on his world tour recounting his journey from darkness into the light. Be encouraged by hearing how God called this soul from the all-too-common modern-day ignorance of Naturalism and unbelief to the Baptismal font of Holy Mother Church

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 32: Strange Wanderings: A Conversion Story of a Young Australian – Part 2
item.description: We continue with Hostess Theresa and guest Augustine – who both now attend Mary Help of Christians Chapel in Australia – accompanying him on his world tour recounting his journey from darkness into the light. Be encouraged by hearing how God called this soul from the all-too-common modern-day ignorance of Naturalism and unbelief to the Baptismal font of Holy Mother Church.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 31: Strange Wanderings: A Conversion Story of a Young Australian – Part 1
item.description: Join Hostess Theresa and guest Augustine as we accompany him on his world tour recounting his journey from darkness into the light. Be encouraged by hearing how God called this soul from the all-too-common modern-day ignorance of Naturalism and unbelief to the Baptismal font in Mary Help of Christians Chapel of Holy Mother Church.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 8: Holy Mass is the Most Powerful Sin-Offering and Most Complete Satisfaction for Sin
item.description: The most powerful sacrifice we can offer to God to atone for our sins is the Holy Mass. In the last episode for this season, Father Julian Larrabee and host Jason Guardiano cover the Holy Mass is the Most Powerful Sin-Offering and The Holy Sacrifice of the Mass is the Most Complete Satisfaction for Sin.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 7: Holy Mass is the Noblest Sacrifice of Thanksgiving and the Most Efficacious Sacrifice of Propitiation
item.description: The Mass is the sacred altar in which the Lamb of God is offered for us where He gives His life for us so we can find grace and mercy. In this episode, Father Julian Larrabee reviews the Holy Mass is the Noblest Sacrifice of Thanksgiving and the Most Efficacious Sacrifice of Propitiation.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 6: Holy Mass is the Most Excellent Burnt-Offering and the Most Sublime Sacrifice of Praise
item.description: Everyone who attends Mass can offer to God this infinite praise and honor we truly need to give Him. Let us attend Mass as often as we can to offer this homage to God and atonement for our sins. Father Larrabee explains how the Holy Mass is the most excellent burnt-offering and the most sublime sacrifice of praise.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 5: In the Holy Mass the Death of Christ and the Shedding of Christ’s Blood is Renewed
item.description: Our Lord laid down His life for our redemption and proved how immense His love is for us. This episode continues Father Larrabee covering the chapters: In the Holy Mass the Death of Christ is Renewed and In the Holy Mass the Shedding of Christ’s Blood is Renewed.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 4: In the Holy Mass Christ Renews His Intercession and His Passion
item.description: As often as the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass is offered, so often does Christ plead for those who offer it and for those whom it is offered. Father Larrabee explains how in the Holy Mass Christ renews His Intercession and His Passion.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 3: In the Holy Mass Christ Renews His Nativity and His Life on Earth
item.description: Everyday we can be present at Our Lord's Nativity if only we would go to Mass. Father Julian Larrabee covers the renewal of Our Lord's Nativity and Our Lord's Life on Earth in the Holy Mass.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 2: The Great High Priest of the New Testament and The Mysteries of Holy Mass
item.description: In this episode, Father Larrabee continues the section on The Excellence of the Holy Mass with Our Lord's Priestly Function in offering the Holy Sacrifice.

item.title: The Incredible Catholic Mass, Episode 1: The Nature and Excellence of Holy Mass
item.description: The Holy Sacrifice of the Mass is the perfect sacrifice. A sacrifice is an offering that we make to God and is consecrated in a solemn manner by a consecrated priest in recognition that God is the Supreme Being. Father Julian Larrabee and host Jason Guardiano begin this series with examining the Nature of Holy Mass and the Excellence of Holy Mass.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 56: The Fifth Commandment (Part 2)
item.description: In this final episode for the season, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur finish their discussion on the Fifth Commandment of God.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 55: The Fifth Commandment (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur begin a discussion on the Fifth Commandment of God.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 54: The Fourth Commandment (Part 3)
item.description: In this last part on the Fourth Commandment of God, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur discuss the duties of parents and the obligations of Civil Rulers.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 53: The Fourth Commandment (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur continue to discuss the Fourth Commandment of God and our obligations to those in authority.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 52: The Fourth Commandment (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur discuss the Fourth Commandment of God and the duties it obliges in regard to our parents.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 51: The Third Commandment
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur discuss the Third Commandment of God and the duties it obliges in order for us to keep the Lord's day holy.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 50: The Second Commandment: Vows
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur continue their study of the Second Commandment of God with a discussion on vows and the positive elements of the Second Commandment.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 49: The Second Commandment
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur for the first episode of the season where they begin studying the Second Commandment of God with a discussion on sins against His Holy Name, on blasphemies, on oaths, and more.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 45: Mystici Corporis (Part 3)
item.description: In this episode, Fr. Dutertre and Ethan conclude their discussion of Mystici Corporis and its important teachings on the Mystical Body of Christ - The Catholic Church!

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 44: Mystici Corporis (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode, Fr. Dutertre and Ethan continue their discussion of Mystici Corporis covering such topics as Christ as Head of the Church and the pope as His Vicar on Earth; the role of the bishops; and the Church as the sole means of salvation and what this means in light of the Novus Ordo Religion.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 43: Mystici Corporis (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, Fr. Dutertre and Ethan begin a discussion on Mystici Corporis by Pope Pius XII. Examining first what was occurring in the world that prompted Pope Pius XII to write this encyclical, Father then expounds upon its important teachings on the Mystical Body of Christ - The Catholic Church!

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 23: The COVID "Vaccine" Revisited
item.description: After months of inoculations and millions upon millions of doses, Father Stephen McKenna and Dr. Daniel Stanislowski sit down to revisit the COVID "Vaccine" in this special bonus episode of Pastoralia, in order to see just how well its promises and safety are holding up to reality. Join us as we explore how well the biggest science experiment in history is going... this is one episode you don't want to miss!

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 42: E Supremi
item.description: In this first episode of the season, new host Ethan Bubba discusses the encyclical E Supremi by Pope St. Pius X with Father Damien Dutertre. E Supremi was the first encyclical written by Pope St. Pius X and provided a glimpse of what his pontificate would be like and his goal of "restoring all things in Christ."

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 37: The Spies and the Bread of Life Discourse
item.description: Unsurprisingly, as they frequently do in the Old Testament (and the New), the Jews show their infidelity to the commands of the Lord and pay the price for disobedience. In the New Testament segment Our Lord gives His magnificent Bread of Life discourse.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 36: Laws for Divine Worship and The Miracles of the Loaves and Fishes and Walking on Water
item.description: Our Lord is not just clear and exacting on how He wants the Tabernacle to be built, but also how He wishes to be worshipped. Father and Stephen also discuss the Miracles of the Loaves and the Fishes and Our Lord’s walking on water.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 35: The Making of the Tabernacle and the Death of John the Baptist
item.description: Our Lord gives many exact details for the building of the Tabernacle that foreshadows Our Lord and Our Lady. We once again see how important and sacred the Church sees marriage in the death of St. John the Baptist.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 34: The Golden Calf and The Sending Out of the Apostles
item.description: Our discussions of Sacred Scripture continue, with Fr. Trauner and Stephen discussing the creation (and destruction) of the golden calf, as well as Our Lord’s sending out of the Apostles.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 26: The Death Penalty and War
item.description: This episode was recorded after the release of Bergoglio’s monstrous Fratelli Tutti, and is ever more relevant as Professor Amerio argues for the Church’s positions on the death penalty (always approved) and war (only when just) and how those subjects should be examined in a post-WW2 world.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 25: Divorce, Sodomy, Abortion
item.description: Professor Amerio wrote this book in the 1980s and passed away in the late 1990s, so he would quail to see what has happened regarding these issues now. Nevertheless, his helpful documentation shows silly arguments being advanced in favor of divorce and abortion by bishops who should be guardians of marriage and the lives of the innocent, respectively.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 24: Faith, Hope, and the Natural Law
item.description: In this episode, Father and Stephen discuss the Modernists’ attack on Faith (opposing it to reason), Hope (creating a new definition), and the Natural Law.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 23: Pyrrhonism, Dialogue, Mobilism
item.description: Professor Amerio talks about the philosophical problems of Pyrrhonism (a skepticism of knowledge of basic truths) and Mobilism (the process of endless “searching” for truth) and how the imprecise and silly term “dialogue” relates to both of them. Once again we see a long shadow that would manifest in Bergoglio many decades later.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 22: The Religious Orders
item.description: In this episode, the sad tale of the destruction of the religious orders is told, and worse, how they destroyed themselves without any help from the outside world.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 21: Catechetics
item.description: In this episode, Father and Stephen explore Professor Amerio’s comments on the “new catechetics,” which uses words we’ve unfortunately come to hear too often: “encounter,” “search,” “deepening,” “human dignity,” “dialogue,” etc. as substitutes for the knowledge and certainty which comes with knowledge of the Catholic Faith.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 20: Schools
item.description: In this episode, Father and Stephen discuss the destruction not just of Catholic schools, but the destruction of Catholic education, the rise of (inferior) public schools, the mangling of the teacher-student relationship, and the value of knowledge in a society.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 19: Religious and Social Movements
item.description: This series which examines Professor Romano Amerio’s significant work documenting what he calls “changes in the Catholic Church” continues this season by examining the effect that Vatican II had on social movements and political parties, both in the episcopacy and on lay leaders. Marxism, Pacem in Terris, and language that foreshadows Bergoglio are also discussed.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 22: The Life and Miracles of St. Cuthbert
item.description: In this episode of Trad Reviews, we will be discussing the account of the Life and Miracles of St. Cuthbert, written by St. Bede the Venerable. After a brief introduction to Sts. Bede and Cuthbert, we will examine the Life and Miracles of St. Cuthbert chronologically, picking up and discussing miracles found to be particularly edifying in today's age. Naturally, this work is attractive to any Catholic, but it is particularly endearing owing to it being an easy read (especially being written by a Doctor of the Church); anyone with an interest in the early English Church will find this book to be an edifying example of the holiness of the English saints, but all will benefit from St. Cuthbert's example, as shown in the review.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 21: The Reluctant Saint and The Song of Bernadette
item.description: In this episode, host William Long reviews two saint films: The Reluctant Saint which is about St. Joseph Cupertino, and The Song of Bernadette which is about Our Lady of Lourdes and St. Bernadette.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 20: Saga of Citeaux and Disc Golf
item.description: In this episode, host Alexander Krawczyk talks about the first two novels in the series The Saga of Citeaux written by Fr. M. Raymond O.C.S.O., and then concludes the episode by introducing our listeners to the outdoor activity of disc golf.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 19: St. Genesius Films
item.description: In this episode host Stephen Heiner talks about St. Genesius Films, created and supported by the Petrizzi Family, and in particular the three films that are available on YouTube for you to watch: A Saint in Hiding (about the Cure of Ars) Little Rose (about St. Rose of Lima) Our Mother Elizabeth (about St. Elizabeth of Hungary) This episode also features a short exclusive commentary from Hannah Petrizzi about the origin story of St. Genesius Films and what lies ahead.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 18: A Trio of Joans of Arc
item.description: In this episode host Stephen Heiner examines, critiques, and offers recommendations for and against three portrayals of the Maid of Orleans on film: the 1948 Victor Fleming film starring Ingrid Bergman the 1962 Robert Bresson film starring Florence Chassez the 1928 Carl Theodor Dreyer film starring Renee Maria Falconetti For those unfamiliar with the details of the story of St. Joan, Stephen begins the episode by reading the declaration written by St. Pius X on the day of Joan’s beatification in 1909.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 17: Mahjong, Chinese Chess, and Carcassonne
item.description: In this episode host Stephen Heiner shares his experiences playing two Eastern games and a well known Western game and shares why they might make excellent additions to the games your friends and family play. As promised in the episode, here is the link to the Chinese Chess course created by a colleague of Stephen’s who introduced him to the game: https://www.udemy.com/course/how-to-play-chinese-chess/

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 16: The Hidden Life of the Clergy
item.description: In this episode, host Stephen Heiner discusses and reviews two novels, Death Comes for the Archbishop, by Willa Cather, and The Diary of a Country Priest, by Georges Bernanos as well as a film on the Bernanos novel directed by Robert Bresson. These works demonstrate to us the challenges our clergy have to deal with, the common failings we all have as sinners seeking redemption, and the possibilities of love and grace that abound all around us, if only we will reach for them.

item.title: TradReviews, Episode 15: Diplomacy, Gettysburg, and Gods and Generals
item.description: In this season premiere episode, Theresa and Alexander discuss the board game Diplomacy in which players must use their diplomatic wits to win this World War 1 era grand strategy game. Then the two conclude the episode by discussing the two films Gettysburg, and Gods and Generals

item.title: The Councils, Episode 24: The Council of Florence, Part II
item.description: With its earlier challenges out of the way, the Council was free to turn its attention to union with the Schismatics, which resulted in a magnificent, if once again, short-lived, union with the Greeks, but in more lasting form with other Schismatics who arrived after the Greeks paved the way.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 23: The Council of Florence, Part I
item.description: The first part of this two-part miniseries on the Council of Florence gives the background to the Council, including its strange beginnings in Basel and its move to Ferrara. Some positive reforms in Bohemia are achieved.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 22: The Council of Constance
item.description: The Council of Constance resolved the Great Western Schism, but it also gave birth to a new error, Concilarism, which would continue to be felt for centuries after.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 21: The Council of Vienne
item.description: A curious and interesting council that resolved, at least for a time, a split between the French Crown and the Papacy via the suppression of the Knights Templar. This was also the first Council convoked during the Babylonian Captivity of the Papacy, in Avignon. The Feast of Corpus Christi also dates from this Council.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 20: The Second Council of Lyons
item.description: This Council occurred not long after what had been a 3 year vacancy of the Holy See as well as the tragic sack of Constantinople by a sidetracked Fourth Crusade. Blessed Gregory X presided over this Council and, with great assistance from St. Bonaventure, managed to get a formal decree of union signed between the Latin and Greek churches. Unfortunately, it would not last long. St. Thomas Aquinas also died on the way to this council.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 19: The First Council of Lyons
item.description: This is another council that was held mostly to deal with a Frederick Barbarossa: this time it was his grandson, Frederick II, who was making a lot of trouble for the Church. Innocent IV presided over it and excommunicated and deposed Frederick at its close.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 18: The Fourth Lateran Council
item.description: The Fourth Lateran Council was needed some years after the Third Council to deal with the continuing problems with Albigensians and a new group, the Waldenses. The council was presided over by Pope Innocent III. Among other traditions, the Easter Duty dates from this Council.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 17: The Third Lateran Council
item.description: We begin another season of looking into the enormously important ecumenical Councils that have shaped Church history.The Third Lateran Council was presided over by Pope Alexander III and had as its main antagonists Frederick Barbarossa and the Albigensian heresy.

item.title: The Four Last Things, Episode 8: The Joys of Heaven
item.description: In our last episode, Father Julian Larrabee covers the supernatural joys of the Beatific Vision and the contemplation of God.

item.title: The Four Last Things, Episode 7: The Nature of Heaven
item.description: If we save our souls, by praying to God for His grace, we receive the reward of Heaven.

item.title: The Four Last Things, Episode 6: The Other Torments of Hell
item.description: Father Julian Larrabee reminds us that the company of Hell will add to the torments of Hell, so having any family or friends in Hell will only add to the misery and despair.

item.title: The Four Last Things, Episode 5: On the Fire of Hell
item.description: Hell is real and it is important to know what Hell is like so that we can avoid it.

item.title: The Four Last Things, Episode 4: The Last Judgment
item.description: Join Father Julian Larrabee in this continuation of the Last Judgment as he discusses the sentencing of all mankind and the resulting aftermath.

item.title: The Four Last Things, Episode 3: Leading Up to the Last Judgment
item.description: When we commit mortal sin it is an infinite evil and infinite insult to the Divine Majesty for which we will stand in judgment before Almighty God in front of the entire human race.

item.title: The Four Last Things, Episode 2: The Fear of Hell and On the Judgment
item.description: In this second part on death, Father Julian Larrabee describes what we will witness at our death and our particular judgment.

item.title: The Four Last Things, Episode 1: On the Terrors of Death
item.description: In Father Julian Larrabee and host Jason Guardiano begin a series on The Four Last Things: Death, Judgment, Hell, and Heaven.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 30: Corona Edition (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode of the Catholic Home Show: Corona Edition (Part 2), Host Theresa, and Guest Jacinta, discuss some personal perspectives pertaining to the Covid-19 vaccination.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 29: Corona Edition (Part 1)
item.description: In this bonus episode of The Catholic Home Show: Corona Edition (Part 1) - Host Theresa, and Guest Jacinta, discuss their experiences of living under one of the most extreme and lengthy draconian lockdowns which was imposed in Victoria, Australia, through several months of 2020.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 22: Spiritual Consequences of COVID
item.description: When a life-changing event impacts our lives, how should we as Catholics react spiritually?

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 21: Practical Consequences of COVID
item.description: Over the past year, its become clear that there is more surrounding COVID than just a simple virus.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 20: COVID Masks
item.description: The importance wearing masks in public places during the "plandemic" has been forced upon us ad nausem, but do they actually work?

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 19: The COVID Vaccine
item.description: After a year of masks, lockdowns and social distancing, the "pandemic" still lives on and presents us with a new concern - the COVID vaccine.

item.title: Islam: The Real Truth About the “Religion of Peace”, Episode 10: Forgotten Islamic Massacres - India, Armenia, and Smyrna
item.description:
Every time we hear about terrorist attacks today we are always told that they have “nothing to do” with Islam. But this is not a new development. Islamic massacres have been swept under the rug for a long time. We discuss three specific ones in this episode.
PLEASE NOTE: This program presumes the listener knows that Catholicism is the one true Faith and that the Catholic Bible contains the only true Sacred Scripture. **WARNING: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE MATERIAL COVERED IN THIS SHOW, THIS SERIES IS NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, NOR FOR THOSE WITH DELICATE SENSITIVITIES.

item.title: The Beautiful Things, Episode 9: The Sense of Taste: Da Vinci Last Supper, Veronese Wedding Feast at Cana: Contrasts...or Similar?
item.description: Bishop Daniel Dolan and Stephen Heiner conclude their mini-series on the senses with this episode on The Sense of Taste by discussing two famous pieces of artwork; Da Vinci's Last Supper and Veonese's Wedding Feast at Cana.

item.title: The Beautiful Things, Episode 8: The Sense of Smell - Incense in the Liturgy...and in the home?
item.description: Bishop Daniel Dolan and Stephen Heiner continue their mini-series on the senses with this episode on The Sense of Smell- Incense.

item.title: The Beautiful Things, Episode 7: The Sense of Touch - The Bayeux Tapestry
item.description: Bishop Daniel Dolan and Stephen Heiner continue their mini-series on the senses with this episode on The Sense of Touch - The Bayeux Tapestry. His Excellency and Stephen discuss this two-hundred-foot-long tapestry and the history depicted upon it; as well as Our Lord's use of fabric throughout Christendom, i.e. The Shroud of Turin, Veronica's Veil, Our Lord's Tunic, and Our Lady of Guadalupe's Tilma.

item.title: The Beautiful Things, Episode 6: The Sense of Sound - Bells in the Liturgy and in Life
item.description: Bishop Daniel Dolan and Stephen Heiner begin a mini series on the senses with this episode on The Sense of Sound - Bells in the Liturgy and in Life. His Excellency and Stephen discuss the use of bells in society, the liturgy, and in the home.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 48: The First Commandment - The Veneration and Invocation of the Saints
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander for the final episode of the season where they conclude the First Commandment with discussion on the Catholic way of venerating Saints, Relics and Holy Images, making use of Sacramentals and how these are justified against the accusations made by Protestants.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 47: The First Commandment – The Honour and Worship of God (Part 3)
item.description: Listen in as Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander finish the section of the First Commandment on the honour and worship of God and specifically regarding the sins against exterior worship of God.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 46: The First Commandment – The Honour and Worship of God (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander continue the section on the Honour and Worship of God, with a focus on the sins of presumption and despair, and the attitude which Catholics should adopt today.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 45: The First Commandment – The Honour and Worship of God
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander as they cover the First Commandment, specifically on the Honour and Worship of God and the ways in which this obligation are easily overlooked.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 44: On Christian Self-Love
item.description: In this episode Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander discuss how charity applies to oneself and of the notion of Christian Self love, differentiating between what this truly is as opposed to the modern ideals which are such a risky trap with the way society is currently.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 43: On the Love of Neighbor (continued)
item.description: This episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander discuss with more depth how charity applies to the love of our neighbour and the differences between the modern notion of what is and is not charity, and then covering the Corporal and Spiritual works of Mercy and their application in current times.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 42: On the Love of God and Neighbor
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander continue section 1 of the Commandments, which covers the chief Commandment of Charity.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 41: On the Love of God
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and Alexander Arthur as they begin to talk about the Commandments of God.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 41: Casti Conubii (Part 6)
item.description: In this sixth and final episode of our coverage of this encyclical on Catholic marriage, Fr Dutertre wraps the encyclical up by covering paragraphs 100 to the end.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 40: Casti Conubii (Part 5)
item.description: In this fifth episode of our coverage of this encyclical on Catholic marriage, Fr Dutertre covers paragraphs 79 to 99 of Casti Conubii.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 39: Casti Conubii (Part 4)
item.description: In this fourth episode of our coverage of this encyclical on Catholic marriage, Fr Dutertre covers paragraphs 62 to 78 of Casti Conubii.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 38: Casti Conubii (Part 3)
item.description: In this third episode of our coverage of this encyclical on Catholic marriage, Fr Dutertre covers paragraphs 44 to 61 of Casti Conubii.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 37: Casti Conubii (Part 2)
item.description: In this second episode of our coverage of this encyclical on Catholic marriage, Fr Dutertre covers paragraphs 18 to 43 of Casti Conubii.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 36: Casti Conubii (Part 1)
item.description: In this first episode on this most important encyclical on Catholic marriage,, Fr Dutertre covers paragraphs 1 to 17 of Casti Conubii.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 35: Notre Charge Apostolique (Part 4)
item.description: In this episode, we honour an outstanding commitment to finish our coverage of St Pius X's encyclical Notre Charge Apostolique, with special guest Father Damien Dutertre and host Matthew Gaskin.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 34: Notre Charge Apostolique (Part 3)
item.description: In this episode, we honour an outstanding commitment to finish our coverage of St Pius X's encyclical Notre Charge Apostolique, with special guest Father Damien Dutertre and host Matthew Gaskin.

item.title: The Missions, Episode 4: Stories from the Trenches
item.description: The Fathers share some stories from their missionary work: the good, the bad, and everything in between.

item.title: The Missions, Episode 3: An Enemy Hath Done This: Splits
item.description: Splits are an inevitable part of life in any human organization, but even in the supernatural organization of the Church they come.

item.title: The Missions, Episode 2: What does it take to maintain a Mission?
item.description: Once a mission has been established, what’s next? How are marriages and confirmations dealt with? Catechetics and Confessions?

item.title: The Missions, Episode 1: What Does It Take to Establish a Mission?
item.description: In this special miniseries, we meet Frs. Arnold Trauner and Stephen McKenna, two priests who have covered literally dozens of missions over a 20-year time span, in all parts of the world.

item.title: Clerical Conversations, Episode 32: The Catholic School
item.description: Join Father Eldracher and his brother Justin as they discuss what the ideal of a Catholic school is, and how we can come close to that during the ongoing crisis in the Church.

item.title: Clerical Conversations, Episode 31: Organ Music in the Church
item.description: In this episode of Clerical Conversations, Father Eldracher and his brother Justin talk about the history of organs in liturgical music and delve into the intricacies of how they produce such a wide range of sounds.

item.title: Clerical Conversations, Episode 30: Fatima-Industrial Complex
item.description: In this episode of Clerical Conversations, Bp Dolan and Stephen discuss the Fatima-Industrial Complex, and the problems inherent in using private revelation to form your spiritual life and theological worldview.

item.title: Clerical Conversations, Episode 29: American Heroes
item.description: In this episode of Clerical Conversations, Bp. Dolan shares some stories of the true early American heroes: the missionaries.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 18: Vaccines
item.description: In this final episode of the season, Fr. McKenna discusses whether it is moral to vaccinate your child and then goes on to discuss the state of modern vaccines and things we should be aware of before vaccinating our children.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 17: Big Bang Theory
item.description: In this episode, Stephen and Father explain Big Bang Theory, Pius XII’s reference to it, and whether it is compatible with Catholic cosmology.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 16: Aliens
item.description: Why is there such an obsession with alien life and colonies on Mars or the Moon? What does the Church have to say on these subjects? Take a listen to this episode for some perspectives on this rarely-covered topic.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 15: Heliocentrism, Geocentrism, and Flat-Earth
item.description: In this episode, Father and Stephen discuss heliocentrism and geocentrism from the perspective of what the Church has taught and what is permissible to hold.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 14: Drugs and Narcotics
item.description: In this episode, Father McKenna talks about medical marijuana and whether it can be used by Catholics.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 13: Public Bathing and Watersports
item.description: In this episode, Father and Stephen discuss the cult of sunbathing and the necessary precautions one needs to take in order to swim in a public setting.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 12: Modesty
item.description: Modesty is an issue of great concern to Our Lady, and hence necessarily to Our Lord.

item.title: Pastoralia, Episode 11: Immigration
item.description: In this first episode, we discuss a hot button issue around the world: immigration.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 8: The Nativity
item.description: In our season finale, we consider Our Lady in the mystery of the Birth of Christ.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 7: The Visitation
item.description: In this episode, we discuss the beauty and charity of Our Lady during the Visitation, and, of course, Our Lady's response to St. Elizabeth - the Magnificat!

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 6: The Annunciation
item.description: In this episode, we study a truly beautiful event in the life of Our Lady and the history of our salvation, the Annunciation!

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 5: The Life of Our Lady to the Annunciation
item.description: In this episode, we begin our study of the life and virtues of Our Blessed Mother up to the Annunciation.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 4: The Immaculate Conception (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode, Father Germàn Fliess discusses the very unique history of the dogma of the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary as men sought to understand it throughout the ages of the Church culminating in it’s dogmatic proclamation by Pius IX in 1854 in the encyclical Ineffabilis Deus.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 3: The Immaculate Conception (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, Father Germàn Fliess discusses the sublime dogma of the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary and the various proofs found throughout Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 2: Devotion to Mary in the Mind of the Church and of the Saints
item.description: In this episode, Father Germàn Fliess discusses the main principles concerning devotion to Our Lady, drawn from the teaching of the Popes, the Fathers and Doctors, the Saints and theologians.

item.title: Our Lady in Doctrine and Devotion, Episode 1: The Divine Maternity
item.description: In our series premiere, Father Germàn Fliess discusses the foundation of the whole edifice of Mariology and the basis upon which all the great privileges of Our Lady ultimately rest - the Divine Maternity.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 33: Ten Commandments and Miracles of Our Lord
item.description: In our season finale, the Israelites receive the Ten Commandments from God Himself, and in our New Testament half of the episode, we see the miracles of the curing of the infirm woman and the daughter of Jairus.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 32: Miracles in the Desert and Our Lord Stills the Tempest
item.description: In this episode, we discuss the next stage for the Israelites’ journey towards The Promised Land: Our Lord’s providing for their daily bread (literally) and delivering them from their enemies.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 31: Passage of the Red Sea and Parables of Our Lord
item.description: In this episode, the magnificent miracle of the Passage of the Red Sea is discussed, and its prefigurement of the sacrament of Baptism.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 30: The Paschal Lamb and The Wheat and Cockle
item.description: In this episode, we watch the action of the Angel of Death upon the Egyptians, and the type of the Eucharist and the Eucharistic Sacrifice in the Paschal Lamb.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 29: The Ten Plagues and the Parable of the Seed
item.description: In this episode, we discuss the plagues that afflicted Egypt, Pharoah’s hardness of heart, and the justice and majesty of God.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 28: The Burning Bush and Sin Against the Holy Ghost
item.description: In this episode, Moses meets Our Lord in the Burning Bush and receives a mandate to free the Israelites from the tyranny of Pharoah and the Egyptians.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 27: Flight of Moses and The Pool of Bethsaida
item.description: In this episode, we discuss the life of Moses in Egypt in the house of Pharoah and his eventual fleeing from Egypt.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 26: Birth of Moses and St. Mary Magdalen
item.description: In this episode we discuss the Birth of Moses (and his rescue) as well as the episode of St. Mary Magdalen washing Our Lord’s feet.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 16: Second Lateran Council
item.description: In our season finale, we discuss what happens when rival factions of Cardinals conspired to elect their own claimant after the death of Honorius II.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 15: First Lateran Council
item.description: In this episode, we will explore the first Ecumenical Council to be held in the West, and actually in the cathedral of the Popes: the First Lateran Council.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 14: Fourth Council of Constantinople
item.description: The general distrust and unfriendliness between East and West continues to grow and reaches a new level via the coronation of the Holy Roman Emperor, Charlemagne.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 13: Second Council of Nicea
item.description: In an unusual turn (though an unsurprising one) an Emperor leads the charge of heresy.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 12: Third Council of Constantinople, Part II
item.description: In this episode we will review the proceedings of the council, including the first case of heretics using forgeries of Church Fathers to make their case.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 11: Third Council of Constantinople, Part I
item.description: In this episode a new pretender rises up in the place of monophysitism: monothelitism, which is the idea that Our Lord only had one will, instead of two wills that came from His two natures.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 10: Second Council of Constantinople, Part II
item.description: In this episode, the Council itself is discussed.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 9: Second Council of Constantinople, Part I
item.description: In this episode Father Arnold Trauner and host Stephen Heiner will discuss the backdrop to the 2nd Council of Constantinople.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 28: Homeschooling (Part 5)
item.description: **PARENTAL WARNING: Parts of this episode are unsuitable for children** Theresa and Mary finish off this month’s miniseries on Catholic Homeschooling.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 27: Homeschooling (Part 4)
item.description: **PARENTAL WARNING: Parts of this episode are unsuitable for children** Theresa and Jacinta wrap up their overview of the pros and cons of mainstream school and homeschooling in this final episode with Jacinta.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 26: Homeschooling (Part 3)
item.description: **PARENTAL WARNING: Parts of this episode are unsuitable for children** In the course of this miniseries, aspects such as Religion, Evolution, Leftist agendas, Immorality, Lack of discipline, Non-conducive learning environments, Time-wasting, Anti-social behaviour, and more, are discussed in relation to both educational systems.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 25: Homeschooling (Part 2)
item.description: **PARENTAL WARNING: Parts of this episode are unsuitable for children** Theresa and Jacinta continue their discussions on some of the problems with mainstream schools, focusing on the problems created by allowing your children to be taught by secular, and often corrupt, teachers.

item.title: The Catholic Home, Episode 24: Homeschooling (Part 1)
item.description: **PARENTAL WARNING: Parts of this episode are unsuitable for children** Host Theresa, returns this season with Jacinta to warn against the evils of mainstream schools and to encourage all Catholic parents to homeschool.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 18: The Christmas Season
item.description: Bishop Dolan and Justin wrap up this season of The Liturgical Year by sounding the depths of the liturgy of the upcoming Christmas season.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 17: The Mysteries of Advent
item.description: In today's episode, Bishop Dolan and Justin finish their discussion on the holy season of Advent, covering topics such as the three comings of Christ, the liturgical colors of this season, and the Ember Days.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 16: The Beginning of the Liturgical Year
item.description: Join Bishop Dolan and Justin as they start working through the Liturgical Year, starting at the beginning of the temporal cycle.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 15: Redeeming the Time
item.description: In today's episode Bishop Dolan and Justin Eldracher talk about what makes the Liturgy into a Liturgical Year, such as the temporal and sanctoral cycles.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 14: Active Participation
item.description: In today's episode, Bishop Dolan and Justin talk about the true way for us to participate in the Liturgy, and what it can teach us by doing so.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 13: The Preeminence of the Mass in the Liturgy
item.description: This episode is wholly devoted to the crown jewel of the Sacred Liturgy, which is the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 12: Obstacles to True Participation in the Liturgy
item.description: In this episode Bishop Dolan and Justin talk about obstacles to receiving all the benefits of the liturgy, as well as some advice to overcome them.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 11: The Union of Body and Soul in the Liturgy
item.description: Listen in as Bishop Dolan continues to speak about how the liturgy raises our human nature to the Divine.

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 10: The Necessity of the Liturgy
item.description: In this episode, Bishop Dolan talks with Justin about how we just can't escape from public activities, whether it's the Catholic Liturgy or professional sports!

item.title: The Liturgical Year, Episode 9: An Overview of the Liturgy and Its Importance
item.description: Join in as Bishop Dolan talks with Justin Eldracher about how the Liturgy is much more than just a Mass on Sunday!

item.title: Apologetics, Episode 32: The Bishops
item.description: In this series finale, Bp. Donald Sanborn and host Alexander Krawczyk having completed the course on the successor to St. Peter, discuss the successors to the rest of the Apostles - the Bishops!

item.title: Apologetics, Episode 31: Objections Against Papal Infallibility Answered
item.description: In this episode, Bp. Donald Sanborn and host Alexander Krawczyk discuss the answers to various objections made against Papal Infallibilty which in many cases result from an incorrect understanding of what Papal Infallibilty is.

item.title: Apologetics, Episode 30: The Infallibility of the Pope
item.description: In this episode, Bp. Donald Sanborn and host Alexander Krawczyk discuss the infallibility of the Church, and more specifically, of the Papacy itself.

item.title: Apologetics, Episode 29: The Primacy of Christ's Church (Part 2)
item.description: In this episode, Bp. Donald Sanborn and host Alexander Krawczyk conclude a two-part mini-series on the Primacy of Christ's Church with Chapter LIII.

item.title: Apologetics, Episode 28: The Primacy of Christ's Church (Part 1)
item.description: In this episode, Bp. Donald Sanborn and host Alexander Krawczyk begin a two-part mini-series on the Primacy of Christ's Church with Chapter LIII.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 8: Council of Chalcedon (Part II: Some Order Restored)
item.description: In the final episode of the series for the season, the Council of Chalcedon is convoked by Emperor Marcian to resolve the Monophysite question.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 7: Council of Chalcedon (Part I: Monophysitism)
item.description: Within 20 years of the Council of Ephesus, a new error arises: monophysitism, which teaches that Our Lord only had one nature, a divine one.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 6: Council of Ephesus (Part II: Nestorius Condemned)
item.description: The drama of this Council is high, as it begins with a great victory, as Our Lady is proclaimed Theotokos, but quickly devolves into tragedy, as political machinations by bishops lead to a false council running parallel to the true council.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 5: Council of Ephesus (Part I: Nestorius Rises)
item.description: Not content to attack Our Lord’s or the Holy Spirit’s divinity, the forces of evil turn to Our Lady through the heretic Nestorius, and attack the title of Our Lady as “Mother of God,” reducing her merely to “Mother of Christ,” i.e. as the heretics would have us believe, a mother of a purely human entity.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 4: Council of Constantinople (Part II: The Council convenes)
item.description: Such luminaries as St. Gregory of Nazianzen, St. Gregory of Nyssa, and St. Cyril of Jerusalem are included in this important council, which dealt with the new heresies which grew from Arianism, but also was the first ecumenical council neither convoked by the Holy Father nor attended by his legates.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 3: Council of Constantinople (Part I: Events and Key Persons between the Councils)
item.description: In between the Council of Nicea and the Council of Constantinople, errors multiply and spread.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 2: Council of Nicea
item.description: Satan is the father of all lies, and he begins to propagate those lies almost from the very beginning of the Church’s journey.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 1: Council of Jerusalem
item.description: Although not counted as one of the ecumenical councils of the Church, the Council of Jerusalem is nevertheless important to study as a “template” for how Councils work, as well as to see that how Church government worked in Apostolic times was very similar to how it was worked since.

item.title: The Councils, Episode 0: Why Study Church History?
item.description: If Catholics haven’t studied Church history, they will tend to think of the present interregnum as unique in Church history, not having parallels and even worse circumstances.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 33: Divini Redemptoris, Part 3
item.description: In our final episode on Divini Redemptoris, special guest Father Damien Dutertre and host Matthew Gaskin complete their conversation on socialism and finish the discussion on this encyclical.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 32: Divini Redemptoris, Part 2
item.description: In our second episode on Divini Redemptoris, special guest Father Damien Dutertre and host Matthew Gaskin continue the conversation on socialism - specifically in our present-day - and begin to go through the encyclical itself.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 31: Divini Redemptoris, Part 1
item.description: In our first episode on Divini Redemptoris, special guest Father Damien Dutertre and host Matthew Gaskin lay the foundation for discussion on this encyclical by beginning with a conversation on socialism; specifically in our present-day.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 30: Quas Primas, Part 4
item.description: In our final episode on Quas Primas, Bishop Sanborn talks through paragraphs 24 to the end of the encyclical.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 29: Quas Primas, Part 3
item.description: In our third episode on Quas Primas, Bishop Sanborn talks through paragraphs 16-23 of the encyclical.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 28: Quas Primas, Part 2
item.description: In our second episode on Quas Primas, Bishop Sanborn talks through paragraphs 10-15 of the encyclical.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 27: Quas Primas, Part 1
item.description: In our first episode on Quas Primas, Bishop Sanborn talks through paragraphs 1-9 of the encyclical.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 26: Humani Generis, Part 6
item.description: In our final episode on Humani Generis, Bishop Sanborn talks through paragraphs 35 to the end of the encyclical.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 25: Humani Generis, Part 5
item.description: In our fifth episode on Humani Generis, Bishop Sanborn talks through paragraphs 28-34 of the encyclical.

item.title: Popes Against the Modern Errors, Episode 24: Humani Generis, Part 4
item.description: In our fourth episode on Humani Generis, Bishop Sanborn talks through paragraphs 19-27 of the encyclical.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 18: Penance
item.description: Many of our American listeners will be unaware of the Papal indult regarding fast and abstinence that existed during World War II, which then went on to be “normalized” after the War, even before Vatican II and false papal claimants.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 17: Sport
item.description: Professor Amerio could not have conceived how much sport has overtaken the modern world, but even in the period after the Council an irrational esteem of sport was emerging.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 16: Modesty
item.description: Modesty is important in every age, but particularly more in a society in which purity is held in such low esteem.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 15: Women
item.description: In today’s society we have become increasingly used to the calls of “gender equality” but Professor Amerio details this trend which started immediately after the Council, and which revolved around the ideas that women were not considered, by the Church, as “fully responsible human persons.”

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 14: The Youth
item.description: Once again, prefiguring Bergoglio, Paul VI pretends to be “hip” with the youth, and with the assistance of Professor Amerio, Father Trauner and Stephen take a look at the meaningless and trite phrases used by Paul VI and the hierarchy after the Council.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 13: Laicizing the Nation States and the Clergy
item.description: The Crown of Our Lord over society is cast aside as observed in the revision of the Concordat of the Catholic Church with Italy.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 12: The “Reform” of the Curia
item.description: In this episode the “reform” of the Roman Curia is discussed, which is to say, its destruction.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 11: Paul VI, Part 3: Weakness
item.description: In the final episode of the Paul VI mini-series, Father Trauner and Stephen discuss the weakness of Paul VI, tied to his vision of “suffering for” instead of “governing” the Church.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 10: Paul VI, Part 2: Humanae Vitae
item.description: In this second episode of the Paul VI mini-series, Father Trauner and Stephen discuss the unheard of dissent against ostensible “papal” teaching in the case of Humane Vitae.

item.title: Iota Unum, Episode 9: Paul VI, Part 1: Imprecision
item.description: This series which examines Professor Romano Amerio’s significant work documenting what he calls “changes in the Catholic Church” continues in a three-part mini series discussing Paul VI.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 20: The Curtain Closes
item.description: This shameful sham of a council closes with readings by a Catholic, Methodist, and Orthodox, with Paul VI presiding.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 19: Marriage Under Attack
item.description: Moving on to attacking the family, the Council Fathers specifically thwart Paul VI as he strangely tries to make the document more traditional and orthodox.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 18: The Jews and Communism
item.description: Moving from “less popular” schemas to hot button issues, Fr. Trauner and Stephen discuss why anti-semitism is one of the “unforgivable sins” of the modern world.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 17: Schools, Celibacy, the Religious Life, and Missions
item.description: Shorter, lesser-known schemas are the subject of this episode, but particularly relevant was Cardinal Suenens attack on religious: “the distinctive but ridiculous garb of many communities must be changed,” “outdated notions of the inferiority of women” must be abandoned, and “no sister should have to travel with a companion.”

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 16: Divine Revelation
item.description: More arguments regarding “procedure” ensue as opposed to doctrine.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 15: Black Week
item.description: What was Black Week? The liberals had, at the hands of Paul VI, ostensibly had setbacks for Lumen Gentium, Dignitatis Humane, Unitatis Redintegratio, and Our Lady’s title as Mother of the Church. But the reality is that these only appeared to be setbacks.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 14: Lumen Gentium
item.description: In this episode Fr. Trauner and Stephen discuss the three “meanings” of collegiality that were floating around in the discussions about Lumen Gentium, only one of which was orthodox, and which was not the chosen explanation given by the Council.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 13: Dignitatis Humanae
item.description: Perhaps the single most controversial document of Vatican II, Dignitatis Humanae had ferocious “defenders” to make sure that the heretical notion of error having “rights” would be enshrined in what would seem to the outside world to be a document of the Catholic Church.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 12: Gaudium et Spes
item.description: In this episode Fr Trauner and Stephen discuss the expansion of Gaudium et Spes from 45 pages to 122 and the “undue optimism” which everyone attributed to it.

item.title: The Second Vatican Council, Episode 11: Destroying the Schemas
item.description: The series covering the events of the Second Vatican Council returns to discuss sessions 3 and 4.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 10: The Consecration and Life After
item.description: In our series finale, Father guides us through the method of St. Louis on how to make the Act of Consecration as most worthily as possible.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 9: Preparation for the Consecration
item.description: Having completed the book, True Devotion to Mary, Father now guides us through the four-week preparation laid out by St. Louis.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 8: Particular Interior Practices of This Devotion
item.description: In this episode, we examine the various interior practices which are particular to this devotion - namely doing everything by Mary, with Mary, in Mary, and for Mary, that we may do them by Jesus, with Jesus, in Jesus, and for Jesus!

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 7: Particular Exterior Practices of This Devotion
item.description: In this episode, we begin a discussion of the various practices which are particular to this devotion, and we do so by starting with the exterior practices.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 6: Wonderful Effects of This Devotion
item.description: In this episode, Father discusses the beautiful and wonderful effects that this devotion has on the faithful souls who practice it.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 5: Further Motives of True Devotion to Our Lady and Its Prefiguring in Sacred Scripture
item.description: In this episode, Fr. German Fliess and host Alexander Krawczyk finish discussing the various motives which should excite the faithful towards having a true devotion to their Blessed Mother.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 4: A Perfect Consecration to Jesus Christ and its Motives
item.description: In this episode, Fr. German Fliess explains how this beautiful devotion and total consecration of ourselves to the Blessed Virgin Mary is truly a perfect consecration to Our Lord Himself, as well as being a perfect renewal of our baptismal vows.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 3: Choice of True Devotion to the Blessed Virgin
item.description: In this episode, Fr. German Fliess and host Alexander Krawczyk examine the characteristics that mark a true devotion to Our Lady. It should be interior and tender, holy and constant, and with a disinterestedness of personal gain, but to do all for the honor of serving our Queen and Mother.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 2: Fundamental Truths of Devotion to the Blessed Virgin
item.description: In this episode, Fr. German Fliess and host Alexander Krawczyk discuss five fundamental truths of devotion to Our Lady that are critical to our having a true devotion to her, understanding the relationship that already exists between Our Lord, Our Lady, and ourselves, and the great need we have of her in our spiritual lives.

item.title: True Devotion to Mary, Episode 1: The Necessity of the Blessed Virgin Mary and Devotion to Her
item.description: In this premiere episode of our new series, Fr. German Fliess and Alexander Krawczyk delve into the masterpiece of Marian spirituality that is “The True Devotion to Mary” by St. Louis Marie de Montfort.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 25: The patience of Job and John the Baptist sends messengers to Our Lord
item.description: In the final episode of the season, we end the time of the Patriarchs with the story of Job. In the second half of the episode, Father discusses John the Baptist's sending of messengers to Our Lord to confirm that indeed, Our Lord is the Messias, so anxiously awaited for so many centuries.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 24: The deaths of Jacob and Joseph and more Miracles of Our Lord
item.description: Both Jacob and in turn, Joseph die, leaving blessings and prophecies. Our Lord cures a leper and the centurion's servant, and also raises from the dead the son of the widow of Naim.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 23: Joseph reveals himself and the Sermon on the Mount Part IV
item.description: Joseph reveals himself to his brothers, and Jacob himself comes to Egypt, and there is a happy reunion and resolution, all in God's time and according to His Will.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 22: The Sons of Jacob go into Egypt and the Sermon on the Mount Part III
item.description: The story of Joseph is moving slowly towards resolution, as his brothers come to Egypt to buy grain, and he unknowingly, both aids them and puts them through trials.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 21: Joseph's Exaltation and the Sermon on the Mount Part II
item.description: Joseph is freed from prison and is raised to glory in Egypt. In a continuing explanation of the Sermon on the Mount, Father discusses the true justice of the New Law and Our Lord's instructions against hypocrisy.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 20: Joseph in the house of Putiphar and imprisoned and the Sermon on the Mount Part I
item.description: Joseph flees temptation, setting an example for all of us as to how we should react towards sin. Even in his unjust punishment he conducts himself admirably. In the first of four parts, Father examines the Sermon on the Mount.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 19: Joseph sold by his brethren and the cure of the Paralytic
item.description: Brothers consistently fail to get along, and the story of Joseph is no different. His brothers fake his death and sell him into slavery. Our Lord cures a paralytic whose friends are bold and persistent enough to lower him in through the roof.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 18: Jacob and Esau reconcile and Miracles of Our Lord
item.description: In God's good time, Jacob and Esau are reconciled and Our Lord performs miracles and casts out demons in Capharnaum. Later on He shows his command over nature during the miraculous draught of fishes by the Apostles.

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 17: Jacob's Flight and Ladder and Our Lord preaches at Nazareth
item.description: Jacob must flee the wrath of Esau and during his flight he receives promises from God. In Nazareth Our Lord pronounces the breathtaking phrase, "This day is this scripture fulfilled in your hearing."

item.title: Sacred Scripture, Episode 16: Esau and Jacob, and Our Lord at the Well of Jacob
item.description: In the first episode of Sacred Scripture for this season, Father Bede Nkamuke discusses the challenging exchanges between Esau and Jacob and alludes to the punishments that Jacob and Rebecca would receive for deceiving Isaac.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 40: Hell
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and Justin as they finish the Apostles' Creed with a discussion on hell, and why we should think often of hell in order to avoid sin.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 39: Heaven
item.description: Today Father Philip Eldracher and Justin begin discussing the Twelfth Article of the Creed, which states our belief in life everlasting.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 38: Effects of the General Resurrection
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and Justin finish discussing the resurrection of the body, closing the episode at the end of the section on the Eleventh Article of the Creed. **PARENTAL WARNING: Parts of this episode are unsuitable for children*

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 37: The Resurrection of the Body
item.description: Today Father Philip Eldracher and Justin begin discussing the Eleventh Article of the Apostles' Creed, which states our belief in the resurrection of the body.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 36: The Forgiveness of Sins
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and his brother Justin walk through the Tenth Article of the Apostle's Creed, which states our belief in the forgiveness of sins.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 35: Purgatory
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and his brother Justin as they discuss how we can help the suffering souls in Purgatory by prayers, indulgences and other good works.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 34: The Communion of Saints
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and his brother Justin begin section five of the ninth article, talking about the Communion of Saints and the Mystical Body of Christ.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 33: To Judge or Not to Judge
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and his brother Justin as they discuss the true Catholic position on judging heretics, how to avoid rash judgments, and more!

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 32: Excommunication
item.description: In this episode, Father Philip Eldracher and his brother Justin talk about some of the sins which merit excommunication, as well as a couple historical examples of the effects of excommunication.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 31: Heretics, Schismatics, Apostates and Infidels
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and his younger brother Justin as they discuss the distinctions between heretics, schismatics, apostates, and infidels.

item.title: This is Catholicism, Episode 30: Membership in the Catholic Church
item.description: Join Father Philip Eldracher and his younger brother Justin as they begin discussing the fourth section of the ninth article of the Apostles Creed.

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 10: The Current Crisis
item.description: What is actually needful every single day? The Bishop recapitulates some of our themes that we explored in this series and brings it to a practical and useful series of conclusions.

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 9: Spirituality and Prayer
item.description: What should be some basic goals of everyday spiritual practice? What about mental prayer, the Rosary, and the Divine Office?

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 8: Education and Career
item.description: What is the Catholic attitude towards the married life? What are some of the biggest challenges that married couples consistently face and what are ways to deal with them? What is the Catholic teaching on the religious life and how can we prepare to enter such a life?

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 7: Marriage and Vocations
item.description: What is the Catholic attitude towards the married life? What are some of the biggest challenges that married couples consistently face and what are ways to deal with them? What is the Catholic teaching on the religious life and how can we prepare to enter such a life?

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 6: Banking and Work
item.description: In this episode, we continue our mini series on food, clothing, and shelter. What is the Catholic attitude towards clothing? Women are often encouraged to wear more modest clothing, but what about men not dressing like slobs? What is the Catholic attitude towards “fashion”?

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 5: Shelter
item.description: In this episode, we conclude our mini series on food, clothing, and shelter. What is the Catholic attitude towards homes? With the modern reality of mortgages and interest, is “home ownership” the reality that most Catholics hold it up to be? What is the place of multi-generational homes? Where should children live before they truly follow the life God has called them to?

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 4: Clothing
item.description: In this episode, we continue our mini series on food, clothing, and shelter. What is the Catholic attitude towards clothing? Women are often encouraged to wear more modest clothing, but what about men not dressing like slobs? What is the Catholic attitude towards “fashion”?

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 3: Food
item.description: In this episode, we begin a three part mini series on food, clothing, and shelter. What is the Catholic attitude towards food? What is wrong with the modern ways of cultivating and consuming it? How can our stomach be a gateway to virtue? Why should we choose to fast outside of the times we are required to, not just for spiritual but for health reasons?

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 2: Death
item.description: In this episode, we discuss death, specifically Extreme Unction, preparation for death, both in material and spiritual ways, and in proximate and remote instances, Requiem and Gregorian Masses, and how to make the proper arrangements for your funeral instead of leaving it to your loved ones.

item.title: Back to Basics, Episode 1: Birth
item.description: In this episode, we discuss birth, specifically birth control, natural family planning, adoption, choosing names and godparents, and time horizon for baptism.
